review: I love Red Robin. I have been coming here for years. Their Red Robin Gourmet cheeseburger, Banzai burger and the Whiskey River BBQ chicken wrap are delicious. These are a few of my favorite items. I usually only order ranch for my fries, but this time our server brought honey mustard and the other is called Campfire? Not sure, but they were yummy. I love me some dipping sauce. Oh and they got bottomless fries. Their fries are good, especially when you sprinkle their Red Robin seasoning.

It is located in between Cost Market and TJ Maxx across the street from the South Coast Plaza.  We came here on a Saturday around 1pm and it was not busy at all.  I had a patty melt which is my all time favorite, first time I have had 1000 island on it, but it was good, And I love their fries. Sign up for their Royalty card, when you register online you will recieve a coupon for a free appetizer and earn points, I don't think we go there enough to really earn points but I wouldn't mind going back to take advantage of a free appetizer, and you get a burger on your birthday.  Works for me.

Its 3.5/4 stars for the price. Nothing special by any means but the peppercorn burger I had was tasty yesterday. The fries are ok, not my favorite, but the service was good so I enjoyed my experience.

"Red Robin Red Robin send the EMT over"  Goodness gracious I felt like humpty dumpty wobbling out of here after lunch.   I like their no frills burger here.  With bottomless  fries you can't go wrong.  I've been to several Red Robin locations and this one seems to be pretty consistent with their service as well as what the kitchen puts out.   As with most restaurants in the south coast area it gets really busy and packed during the lunch hour.  Probably more so on a Friday.  However we got pretty lucky as we were seated fairly quickly. Royal Red  Robin Burger ~    Mmm I do luv a burger with an egg.  It just makes it oh so yummy with the creaminess of the yolk.   Shredded lettuce, tomato, cheese and applewood smoked bacon.   This is a good decent size burger that will definitely fill you up.  Burger was cook medium well with some charring around the edges and the buns were nice and soft. Onion Rings ~   So instead of fries I decided on onion rings because I don't have them as often as I like.    These were hot, crispy and the onions were cooked perfectly.  Dunk those suckers in some kyaaaatchup and your good to go! Eyes ~ Oh look at that yummy fried egg in there! Nose ~ I smell bacoooooon! Mouth ~ Nom Nom Nom. Tummy ~ Overstuffed ugh!
The burgers here are good. I had the burger with a fried egg and didn't put it down until there was nothing left of it. Red Robin is always a fall back if I can't think of somewhere special to go.

While I love Red Robin food and their fries are to die for, the service here is just horrible. It's really quite depressing. I love the burgers, fries, mac and cheese, raspberry limeade and the shakes. However, don't get me started on the staff. Service has been nothing but slow, it takes FOREVER to get refills on anything. Sometimes I feel like I am just being plain ignored.  When I've been, I've mentioned the service to at least two different managers but it never seems to make a difference. If there was another Red Robin closer to me, I would probably go there instead. Alas, I am stuck with this location and it's horrible service.

So delicious I always wanna come here whenever I get a craving for garlic and yummy burn n love burger. About a month ago n two weeks I was in Japan (food was delicious btw) but while missing American food I always thought of RR and boy do u know it that when we got back we went straight to RR and boy did it taste so delicious I got there peach tea unlimited refill and the burn n love burger with garlic steak fries so good service is awesome when u know the hostess and a server. Love this place.

Burgers starting at just $5.99 with BOTTOMLESS FRIES!! Red Robin is great! To start, they have some pretty amazing burgers! One of my favorites is their bbq bacon burger, but they have another one with an egg in it which is growing popularity. Their burgers are big and thick like a good burger should be. They give you all of the vegetables you'd expect lettuce, tomato, pickle, onion, sauce, and choice of cheese and bun. Another great thing about Red Robin is that ANY BURGER CAN BE MADE VEGETARIAN. So if you're like me and a friend that is vegetarian but you have a huge craving for a juicy all-American burger then you can still go to Red Robin and everyone will be happy. In fact, my friends who are vegetarian love their burgers as much as everyone else so far. So it is a crowd pleaser! The burgers also come with bottomless fries so you can eat to your heart's content!  The restaurants are decorated pretty well with different memorabilia and photos/paintings from the last few decades. It's somewhat like a little museum and is actually quite interesting to look around and start conversations about it while you wait for your food. The restaurant also has a full bar. Somehow overall I would say this is a place you could take your family and kids to while keeping a good clean atmosphere that the whole family, group of friends, or just going alone could enjoy. They advertise as "The Best Burgers in America" and they do a pretty good job of living up to it or at least coming close.
Love this place for lunch!  Wiskey chicken wrap or crispy chicken salad with honey mustard will do the trick! Don't forget the steak fries, onion rings and strawberry lemonade! Yum!

It's funny how they're almost hidden if you're facing Bristol St. You would never know that there's a Red Robin unless you look it up here in South Coast. The service has been exceptional the last few times I've been here. The burgers are juicy. I come here for their pineapple burgers with string onions. Always the best. When we share a burger together, our bill comes down to less than $11.00. That's with bottomless fries. Can someone tell me if Red Robin is affiliated with TGIFridays.

Going downhill. I used really enjoy Red Robin. The Fries used to be my favorite. This time they were just greasy. I had the California Chicken sandwich which was nice and juicy but the food took a long time and my son's chicken was cold when he got it.  Usually its too hot to eat which tells me it was sitting there for a long time.

We started going here a few weeks ago on Fridays with our grandchildren as a treat for good behavior at day care.  Every time we are there, we receive exceptional service and the food is always great.  Last Friday, I took the grandchildren by myself as my hubby was out of town.  The server we had that night (plus our usual & favorite server) went out of their way to take care of us.  Will definitely be going there again!

I ate at this Red Robin location for the first time today when I went there for my coworker's birthday lunch celebration. It's located in a shopping plaza that has Ross, Sports Authority, and TJMaxx. I'd been to this shopping center before but never noticed there was a Red Robin here! It's also near DX Peruvian that I've also been to a couple of times. This is a spacious and clean restaurant. There were about a dozen in our party, and the staff were very helpful in getting our table ready and taking our drink and food orders. I haven't been to a Red Robin in a while.  Previously, I would always get Fish and Chips or Clucks and Fries, but this time I decided to try the Souper Sandwich Combo: a BLTA croissant sandwich (bacon, lettuce, tomatoes, and avocado with chicken) and a cup of French onion soup. I also got a side order of sweet potato fries. The food was so delicious! The sandwich was a good size, cut in two, and tasted fresh and healthy. The soup was so yummy, and so were the fries. Overall, I was very happy with my choice and was glad that I tried something new. I would definitely recommend this Red Robin :)

We've been frequent customers of this restaurant for years, but the last two times we've been here, the service has been terrible.  Both times, our waiter or waitress went on their break during our meal and told us someone else would "cover" for them and "take good care of us".  They didn't ask if we needed anything before they went on break as they rushed off, but told us someone would check on us shortly.  The persons scheduled to "cover" for them took 15 - 20 minutes to check up on us to see if we needed anything which we did.  We wanted refills on our drinks which we didn't get until long after we were finished eating, and I needed something for my meal that finally came after my dinner partner was long finished eating.   On our last visit, a man at a table next to us vented his similar frustrations to the manager and was given a discount on his meal.  I also spoke to the manager about our frustration and he apologized in a very phony manner and was rude about the whole thing saying people needed to take their breaks and he didn't understand why our service was so bad.  I agreed that it didn't make sense, but he did nothing to make up for it.  The waitress who was "covering" finally brought our check and ran our Red Robin card which had a $5 discount on it, and she didn't even print the slip that showed our discount.  I had to call the manager over again and ask him to re-run our card telling him I had received an email about the discount coming to us, and he first said I'd need to contact Red Robin directly and after a few minutes of me insisting that my card be re-run, he did so unenthusiastically and we got our $5 off.   Bad management at this restaurant. They need to work out the issues with waiters taking breaks while waiting on people and make sure there is adequate coverage.

I always have to have their honey mustard with my fries.. That sauce is my favorite there.. Every visit here i always have the whiskey bbq burger. I highly recommend that one.  Their fries are unlimited.  Also a must is their strawberry lemonade ***sign up for their rewards and you get a free burger on your birthday!

Ok so the manager at Red Robin Santa Ana called me and thanked me for the review I did online based on their receipt.  She apologized for the rudeness and unattentiveness of our server.  They sent me a gift card and I went ahead and used this past Friday.  We only had to wait for 10 minutes and were seated.  Our server was the best!  She was very pleasant, helpful, and very efficient.  Except for the fact the bun on the burger my boyfriend ordered was incorrect this was not the server's fault.  She even removed this from our check.  I felt bad for her but made up by giving a good tip.  I am definitely a fan...love their food and as long as I have the same service, I will be back!
$6.99 for a double cheese burger and bottomless fries heck yess!!! Peach milkshake is amazing and servers are always friendly and fast! 2 thumbs up

Their burgers and wraps are pretty darn good and worth the money. They're always having the bottomless fries and their bottomless freckled strawberry lemonades too, yum.  The service here is always exceptional.

I love coming to Red Robin whenever I have the chance and every time I do I just simply love the atmosphere and the service. Today I came in for lunch with my mom and my Aunt around 2:30. Our server Brit T. brought our food out and she noticed my burger was the wrong one. I guess they took my cry baby burger to another table so I had to wait for my meal while my mom and aunt ate theirs so the manager and Brit were nice to not only fix the problem but to take it off our bill. So when people leave reviews about bad service, I want to simply ask if they're high because this place never disappoints me! Kudos Red Robin with your management, service, and staff!

i think our server was a ninja in his previous life. He did so well with greeting us and getting our drinks/appetizers/ entrees right. As far as checking back on us to make sure everything was ok and having a professional demeanor- not so hot. we sat in a corner booth and every time we asked for something he would never come to our table... he would only stay at the bottom of the stairs and reach around the side to mysteriously drop the items off (sometimes even slamming dishes on the table and hitting things we already had). he never thanked us for coming and just dropped our bill off without asking if we wanted anything else.

good burgers and prompt service.  bathrooms were clean and servers were pleasant.  only issue i have is that when giving refills i think it would be a good idea to take our original cup off the table or use our original to refill it.  happens almost every time with multiple servers so it must be a common practice.   Again, nothing major, just wanted to throw that out there.
Ate a sandwich and got food poisoning. When i complained I was told I could get a free meal. No thanks I suffered enough.

Red Robin - always a damn good choice for a cheap sit-down lunch. I keep this gem in my back pocket when I wanna go out but don't want to drop major scrillz. The bottomless fries are the perfect shape for maximum ketchup retention. I always ask for more because they tend to scrimp. The burger styles offered will make everyone happy. My husband adores the steakhouse burger with a fried egg on top. I'm a fan of the whiskey river, or anything with BBQ sauce really ...  Bonus insider tip: you can swap out any burger patty with a chicken breast or turkey patty instead, not bad if you're calorie counting.  Friendly warning: That super cheap 'Tavern Double' burger they keep advertising is way small compared to their other burgers. It's like the size of a fast food burger while the others are restaurant sized.  Over all: Yay for Red!

I have to say that I really enjoyed my bacon cheeseburger and garlic butter fries today. Everything was made the way I asked and was quite good! However, better than the food was our fantastic server...his name tag says Andrew, but he goes by Drew. He was friendly,  warm and attentive. A much better server than one would expect in a hamburger joint. I will request sitting in his section next time I come here.

Love this place! There are pictures covering up every spot on each wall and the servive is always on top of it. which is really important to me, love that. Huge burgers, vegan substitutions, and bottomless fries. Im always looking forward to coming back.
As Red Robin's go, this is about as good as you get service wise. The Crispy Chicken Tender Salad is delicious. Service in the bar is usually better than the floor...

So I dined here yesterday and I've got to say they step upped there burger menu! They are now serving ghost pepper things such as the ketchup and mixed pepper stuff into your burgers. ITS A MUST HAVE IF YOU ENJOY SPICY STUFF! We were not so hungry so we ordered one burger and asked for them to split into two. the waitress was nice enough to leave us with a basket of fries while we waited! after we ordered and munched down on some fries, a couple came in and sat next to us, decided what they wanted and ordered. SURPRISE! their food came in BEFORE OURS. I believe the chefs lost our ticket or something but our waitress noticed we didn't have our food, apologized and ran back to check on our order. immediately right after, the manager came to our table, introduced himself and apologized for the inconvenience which was very nice of him! we were in a good mood anyway so the food being late wasn't a problem but he made it his priority to apologize which earns a 5 star rating. He also offereed to throw in a complimentary dessert on him which I would have loved to accept, but We were just too full from our meal.

I've had nothing but positive experiences at this place! They always get my order spot on (I order a lot of extra stuff usually), the cook it quick, it tastes great, and the server is constantly attending to us!

OMG.  Went there a few times but tonight I sat at the bar and was totally amazed by the great service and conversation, even though they were busy as a one armed paper hanger.  I believe it is Alex and Talia, OMG, they are so fun together.  Really enjoyed the night, the food and the entertainment.  Definately going back soon.

Good food and great drinks, but this specific Red Robin provides the worst service. The waiters were incompetent and careless(well the one that was handling everything for us and this really affects our experience)and I don't see myself going back to this location again.

Great place, great food, great customer service. The price is reasonable and you get bottomless fries. My server was fantastic and the food was hot and fresh. Red Robbin Gourmet Burgers is a great company that cares about their customers. Other burger places may have an edge on burgers but they're also much more expensive. For great burgers at a reasonable price and a pleasant atmosphere you can't beat Red Robin. Yum.

Originally my bf and I were going to Boiling Crab down the street on Bristol, but they didn't open till 3 on a Friday.....so we decided to just eat lunch here instead since I figured there would be something I would want to eat here anyways.  Look through the menu and finally decided I really want a burger....and I was so happy when I saw the choices of lettuce-wrapped burger or gluten-free bun. Since I didn't mind gluten-free anything...I decided to go for the guacamole, swiss cheese, tomato, lettuce and gluten free bun burger. Honestly it gluten free buns don't ever taste the same as regular buns but you know what that burger was still hellishly delicious! I polished off the entire thing....and the sweet potato fries weren't too shabby either.  My bf had their fish n chips and they are also one of my favorite entrees here...flaky, juicy, crispy and not to mention a generous portion of the pieces of fish. MmMmM. Have to say they are pretty consistent with the foods I've tried here so far. The wait is never too bad either.

Red Robin is often picked for our work celebrations because they are very accommodating for large groups.  For our last birthday celebration, we called in our order and everything was ready when we arrived during our lunch hour. Service is always great, they are attentive in making sure we are enjoying our meals.  I recently discovered the garlic fries, yum! Best part: ENDLESS!  One complaint I have is that they took their Southwestern pasta off the menu! :( wahhhhhhhh Im not a big burger person, but I'd have to say that one from Red Robin does hit the spot for me when I'm in the mood for one.

Randomly decided to go here Saturday night before the movies since we were close to this location. What a surprise! It was around 6:00 and we were seated right away. Many families but still good seating. Our server was Sundee and she was excellent. I ordered a chicken salad and it was really fresh, chicken was good and it was served with garlic bread, also ordered the prime french dip with big fat fries and coleslaw. I saw servers walking by with some juicy looking burgers..will have to give that a shot next time.Everything was quite good, service was quick and it was nice to try a place I have never stepped foot in before!
My favorite place honestly..the service is great people are soo nice. Love the benefits of the royal card!!! & food too awesome!

Oktoberfest Burger, no mustard onions and you are good to go! A burger with ham on it, on a pretzel bun.  Seriously, genius.  The pretzel bites are so good too, the mustard is a tad spicy but delicious!!! Service was pretty decent for a Saturday night... we got there at about 5, with no wait, and when we left the place was packed.

I got the Red's Tavern Double Burger for 6.99 with Endless Steak Fries included. The burger was good, and probably the cheapest burger on the menu. If you go here you are going to pay for a 10 dollar burger. I recommend asking for a basket of fries before getting your burger so while you wait you can munch on fries. Red Robin has it's own seasoning, so you sprinkle that on the fries. It helps if you have a rewards card with them. You get a free burger for every 10 burgers you buy. So, when you buy the 10th one you get the 11th one free which is the cheapest burger on your bill and will be labeled 0.00 dollars

I dine here on occasion and never was overly impressed but my last visit was exceptional, our waitress Sundee was amazing she recognized a timing issue on our food and got right on top of it. I knew it was taking long but I was on a hot date and decided to not complain, So funny that  the waitress was in tune to the situation and handled it  the way I would have back in the day when I waited tables. The food was good  but the service will bring me back.

Great customer service at this location! Red Robin is one of my all time favorite burger joints! So many delicious menu items to choose from and they have amazing promotional items. I love the Whiskey River BBQ burger, so good! The only way Red Robin could be more amazing is if they'd add the Sweet Jim Beam® Bacon Swiss burger as a regular menu item. They also have the best ranch and honey mustard I've ever had! Plus you can't beat their bottomless steak fries.

In a nutshell, this is a run-of-the-mill burger joint that hits the spot.  Plus, you can substitute a veggie burger for any of their burgers, which is why we keep coming back. The service here is great, so much so that it turns a 3 star review into a 4 star one.  A.J. was our server, and he was awesome.  The service here was more friendly and competent than the service at the Irvine Spectrum location.

I've been to many Red Robins, and they're all pretty decent. This location is no different. Many choices. Huge salads. $3.99 grilled cheese with a side! I freaking love grilled cheese. I'm not a big fan of their specialty cheeseburgers, so I usually stick with the regular ones. They add pickle relish though. Yuck.

The service was good but the food here is terrible. I have been here twice and neither experience has been enjoyable. The food does not taste fresh, I'm convinced that the meat they use is frozen. It is very flavorless. If you do decide to waste your money and eat here, do everything in your power to stay away from their guacamole. They do not make fresh guacamole, in fact there is nothing in it that even resembles an avocado aside from a greenish color. If you decide to ignore my advice and try it, the only thing you will taste in that pile of green slop is salt. Lots of salt.  Please don't eat here, if you love good food, don't do it. If you really want a hamburger, Ruby's is within walking distance and In-n-Out is a block away. There is only one good reason to eat at Red Robin and that is to experience one of the worst meals of your life. If I could give Red Robin NO STARS, I would. Unfortunately I have to give them a star to write this review.

Im sooo a fan of this place. There fries are the bomb.  Customer service is always the same no matter which location, excellent.  The burgers are not off the chain but different in their own red robin lovely way.

Came here on New Years Day. It was actually kinda romantic in a weird way. After finding the ideal seating, the service kinda sucked but the manager made up for that.  This location is near the two big shopping malls - South Coast Plaza and Crystal Court. It's perfect if you want a quick dinner before a movie or something to keep you full while you shop. I usually get the chicken caesar wrap but opted to try a new burger on their menu. It was overwhelming with bbq sauce and some other bourbon/whisky something or other. Just way too much for my taste. I should have gotten the bleu cheese. That tasted way better.  I also love that this place has bottomless steak fries. I love a good fry with plenty of ranch dressing and their seasoning. I could eat those all day long.

This is another place I've been coming to for years and the quality is always very consistent. The food is reasonably priced. The service is always very friendly. They serve all beverages including water in real glass. The atmosphere is casual and comfortable. You get unlimited steak fries and RR serves great steak fries. Honestly, I can't think of anything negative to say about them.

Always happy with my Red Robbin adventures. We had recently went to this location. We were in a bit of a rush cause we needed to catch a movie at south coast after we ate. We elected to eat in the bar area and we were seated immediately. Since being in a hurry we ordered right away and we received our order in a timely manner.  I ordered a fav of mine (Bruschetta Chicken Sandwich) besides all the delicious burgers options they have. But the reason I love going to RR is the bottomless fries! They are the fat steak type fries with I love! The only thing that kind of irked me was the amount of fries that I got with my sandwich. There was probably like six total. I instantly ordered another refill of fries for the both of us. We get a refill basket and again it was a pretty pathetic portion. I know they are bottomless. But it looked like they were skimping on the amount they used to give out. Shacking my fist at the economy!!!! I'm sure I didn't need as many fries as I would of wanted health wise so I guess they did me a favor.  This is always a good place to go on your birthday cause they have a sign up for a free meal or your special day!

Horrible.  Worst service I have ever had. My server was named Dori and she was not only rude but got both orders wrong. When i kindly asked if she could fix it she then proceeded to say I was wrong and the order was exactly what I asked for then rolled her eyes at me and said i guess i can fix the food. Received the food back and it was still WRONG , so hungry ate the food. The Manager was kind but the service was so bad I shalt go back. Horrible  STAY AWAY!

This Red Robin is way busier than others because it is next door to South Coast Plaza.  We sat in the bar area to avoid a wait.  This was probably our mistake.  The waitress was very unattentive.  We kept being out of drinks.  At one point she was bringing me a drink refill which was on her tray yet she stopped at three other tables before dropping off my drink.  It was just really slow service otherwise the food was good.

This 2 star rating is for their to-go service I just had. On any other day I love red robin for their bottomless fries, salads, and freckled lemonade. But today, i'm not too happy.  I ordered the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Salad, and asked for no chicken, with a side of fries. When I came home and opened it, I was disappointed. They didn't include any BBQ sauce, which is the dressing for this particular salad. Instead they gave me three things of ranch. It doesn't get ranch nor is it necessary for that much. Plus, the side of fries I asked for, there were maybe less then half a box full. That was no where near a full order of fries. AND they were completely unseasoned. That was the only reason I got them! I love the seasoned fries. And if they come that way, then why not ask me if I would like some seasoning on the side? So now I'm left with a naked salad, bland fries, and a ton of ranch.  I've had this salad once before and fell in love. So I was excited for it, and it sucks when you get all the way home and discovered they didn't do their job. And I paid $13 - for one salad and fries. I wont be splurging their again any time soon.  Red Robin- please double check your to-go orders.
Service is fine when the place is empty, but its soooooo slow when they get even just a little bit busy.

I'm just going to make this short and sweet. There are a lot of commercial restaurants out there competing for space. For me, this one has the best environment GREAT employees, and a superb menu. I highly recommend the chili, which is often overlooked. If you're not into places like Chili's or TGIF's, this won't fair much better, but if you don't mind those environments, this one is your best bet.

For some reason I was craving a burger this afternoon. My girl and I went for lunch. Staff was distracted and oblivious, save for one nice blonde young lady. Our server, a younger female bartender, didn't visit our table once after taking my entree order and visited the table behind me 4 times during that time period. I understand Costa Mesa isn't always welcome to certain...sorts of people, but c'mon. Get with the program.

Always happy with Red Robin. Although, when traveling, I try to avoid big chain restaurants, sometimes, you just want some food that you KNOW will be good - and Red Robin always fits the bill. This one is large and clean, and the wait staff is friendly. That's a win in my book.

Had a perfect Lean and Green lunch (TSFL eaters). Turkey burger minus bun sub sauce for mustard and subbed fries for broccoli.  294 total calories, 9 grams of carbs and 2 grams of sugar.  Turkey was 5 oz and veggies were about 3 servings. Service was excellent.  We will be here again.

I came here with co-workers during lunch break. The food is mediocre but the service has always been excellent.  The servers are attentive and respectful. The atmosphere is generally fun but can get overly loud. Although, I do prefer Red Robin over other chains such as Chili's & TGIF's.

The food here is delicious, but i really need to knock it down a few stars for it's customer service. I've gone to this place twice, both on trips in which I was traveling alone, and I have to say that the servers really made me feel ignored in both the bar area and the restaurant proper. In both cases, the servers didn't even come up to greet me and get my drink order until I had already seen them service other tables NEAR me, and had to flag them down myself. Considering that I'd come there with a book and managed to knock out a whole chapter between siting down and getting my water, that's says something.

I went here for my high school graduation, a few years ago ;-) I liked it and have been there recently and still love their burgers and fries. I usually do not eat my skinny stick fries with ketchup but Red Robin fries are thick and need ketchup. I tried there Hawaiin Heart Throb smoothie and it is delicious! My sister ordered a virgin pina colada with ice crream, and it was so good. Want to go back for those drinks!

The Guacamole Bacon Burger is a great choice! I don't think I've tried anything better in Red Robin than that dish (I wasn't a fan of the Caesar Wrap - it was really soggy).  The Freckled Lemonade is the highlight of the meal and so are the bottomless fries (with seasoning!). You know I got some Freckled Lemonade to go, too.  The staff changes a lot here. I can't really say much - but it was average.  Huge con though was the noise level! I think there will be somebody having a birthday song sung by the waiters and waitresses every 30 minutes! No joke. If you go here with friends, you'll have to speak up loudly to talk in the restaurant!

I have been to several Red Robins and this has to be the largest one i have ever been too. It's right across the street from South Coast Plaza and next to World Market. I came on a Sunday afternoon and they were relatively busy. As expected on a Sunday, there were a lot of families.  The menu has been updated since I last came here. It's obvious that they are trying to be more creative. This Red Robin is similar to all other ones. If you've been to one, you've been to all of them. The food is okay, but unhealthy. It's a good place for groups or families.

Dont really have a craving for a gourmet burger that often and always seem to forget all the good burger joints when we decide to do burgers and are driving around.  Decided to go here one day from a nearby yelp search and was happily amazed.  Burgers were awesome, service was great, they were super busy so the noise level is kind of high but we fit right in with my bratty son whining at that time so I was thankful for noise.  I got the mushroom swiss burger and its definitely become my favorite burger there.

Most of the burgers here are solid tasty diner type burgers. The only one that is a let down is the Kobe Burger, which the patty is more tender, but does not taste any better (cheap American Kobe meat and not that real Japanese stuff). The Kobe Steak is the same way - just seem like a super tender tv dinner type salisbury steak.

Red Robin is near my apartment, so sometimes if we are in the mood to grab a drink, we just walk over.   I think the drinks are very tasty and slightly dangerous :-)  I couldn't taste the alcohol at all so I ended up drinking it pretty fast.  I was very tipsy off that one drink.  It tasted like an orange creamsicle.   I haven't had a meal here yet, so I can't really say anything about the food.  Although, at other locations, I have enjoyed the veggie burger, so I anticipate that I will love it here too :-)

So usually you know what you can expect from a chain restaurant so I review based on the service that was provided.  I took my son on a weekday during the lunch rush and from the greeting at the door and all through our lunch I thought the service was great.  Perhaps they catered to the fact that I had brought my son in but Chasta and the rest of the staff were awesome.  I've been to this location a handful of times but as a father you know its harder to eat out and please the kids.  Oh and the bruschetta chicken sandwich was great and the fries with the order were small but the extra basket they brought over was completely full and plenty for my son and I.

Short intro, grew up in Costa Mesa, been coming to this red robin since I moved to the city 28 years ago, my mom still lives in Costa Mesa- we were here last night for my sons birthday. Seating time was very fast We sat for a while before our waitress came to take our drink order, too long I threw in an appetizer order with our drink order, because I could tell I needed to make use of the face time with our server the place had several large groups, but wasn't full by any means Our drinks came and our appetizer came When we finished the appetizer, my brother and I stacked up the four plates and the serving dish, because our table was getting filled up with empty drink cups I think my mom eventually asked her to take away the appetizer dishes, she never moved the empty cups our food came and it was good, but I don't think the seasonal burger was that great. We ordered my sun a lava cake sundae and we left. My joked about how ridiculous it was that the cups were never moved and she said "that waitress, was not very good" Which is funny, because usually she wouldn't say anything. I'll post my cup collection picture later.

I haven't been to Red Robin in a VERY LONG TIME. I used to be such a regular here. For years I used to come every Friday with my ex boyfriend and I would always get the same meal. LOL.. i know kind of boring right?  Well anyways, the last time I came here was about 2 years ago and I decided it was my last time because of the horrible service. I couldn't believe how bad this place had gotten.  Well, I decided to give it another shot. My sister convinced me to go. As hesitant as I was I decided to give in and give Red Robin another chance. Well... luckily we got a really good waitress. She was very friendly and was giving us recommendations and tips. For old times sakes I decided to get my old meal that I always used to get. I was very satisfied with my meal and thankful that I didn't experience another bad waiter. Overall, I had a great experience and will be coming back ..... one day.
I am a fan of Red Robin. Great burgers, bottomless fries and a good selection of beers on tap. What else could you ask for? Also, the service is usually very good.

BLTA looked good but they used unrippened avocados. Very poor judgement on their part. And the fry holder is not a cup. It didn't have a bottom so don't move it off your plate otherwise your fries will drop out. Another poor thought by corporate.  Not very thought out idea to show "bottomless" fries.  Waitress said many people do the same and drop food all over the floor.  Service at the bar area was slow and not clean. Customers asked to have the tables and seats cleaned off. Table had to be balanced by a folded napkin. Very disappointed.

It really kills me to write a review on this place but here I am. At least six months ago it had better service, price, and a lot more energy. Now it just seems like another food chain dishing out over priced mediocre food and just mediocre service. For starters their food price has gone up a dollar or two. Can't fault them for that but with the price increase it seems like they just don't care how the food is made. Now we came here on a Monday at around a quarter to three. We were seated promptly and our server wasn't to far behind. She took down our drinks and gave us a few minutes to decide on what we'd like. My sister and I ordered a nacho dip for our appetizer and two  Flamming Love Burgers. Hers with plain fries mine as garlic fries. What's that? You charge $1.50 more to make them garlic?! Ok...I guess. I let it go after all it's a business right? We got our drinks both Strawberry Freckled Lemonade. So waited for our dip for about 20 minutes then it arrived with some really greasy chips and lukewarm nacho sauce piled with a dollop of meat and what seemed to be cilantro but we were hungry so we didn't complain. It was about 35 minutes after getting the appetizer that we got our burger (mind you this was on a Monday at 3pm. Idk why the wait was so long there seemed to be maybe 8 more people in the restaurant) When our burgers finally came I was shocked. The basket full of fries were replaced with some idiotic napkin holder. I was pissed if I'm going to pay $1.50 extra you better bring me a basket of those fries. My sister liked her burger and I did too my only complaint about it was that my bunny was really soggy. So I'm pretty sure our order had been siting there for quite a bite of time. I finished my fries in record time (there were maybe four or six fries that were jammed into that napkin holder they use for their fries now) and flagged down our server to bring me another round. I finished my burger and my drink before she came back with my other order of fries. Thankfully it was a large plateful and I was still hungry. My only other complaint was that our server although upbeat and friendly was pretty damn slow. Took forever on our refills and on clearing the empty glasses away. I'm not picky. I know that being a server requires a lot of energy but on a slow day like that it shouldn't have been much trouble to get refills without a seven to twelve minute gap of wait time. Really kills me to write a review about Red Robin like this. I had amazing times six months ago and even years ago as well. They were fast and their meals great didn't matter if this was during their slowest or busiest times. Sad to say though this place is changing for the worse.

Location: The good: You have a lot of shops nearby because the restaurant is just outside of Southcoast plaza. It's always fun to get a bite to eat and then do some shopping or vise versa. The bad: Parking can be a little tough when it gets crowded. You might have to park pretty far away.  Food: The food is tasty and reasonably priced. There new smoke pepper burger is delicious. I recommend asking for no salt on the fries, because they tend to over salt them.  Service: Every time that I have come here, the service has been sub par. Most of my complaints seem to boil down to the servers being slow. Whether it's refilling drinks or bringing you a check, everything seems to be an ordeal.  If you have a gift card or if you are coming here for a birthday burger, expect a problem. I honestly, don't think they know how to deal with these forms of payment because myself, friends and family all have had problems when we try to pay with these methods.  I probably won't be coming to particular Red Robin anymore, because I'm a little tired of the service.

Not a bad place To go on a boring weekday. The food is pretty good, service could be a little better(kinda slow) The bottomless drinks are good, they do have it to go so don't forget to ask for a refill Togo!

I let my 14-year-old daughter pick the restaurant to eat lunch Sunday, and, of all the really good restaurants around there, she picked Red Robin, sigh. I'd actually never been to a Red Robin. Well it was very crowded (are you kidding me?) and we had to wait, for a LONG time, but at least it was overpriced and the food was bad. Really bad. $32 for a meal that in all seriousness would have been better at Wendy's. Wendy's sells the exact same food for half the price and it tastes better. I had a chicken caesar wrap made with an uncooked, cold tortilla, overcooked frozen chicken breast and a tiny bit of lettuce. Really? It was so dry I had to ask for a little salad dressing on the side to even make it edible at all. And my daughter had an undercooked burger that was thin and tasteless. The burger patty looked like the cheap ones from Costco. She asked for avocado on it and they gave her guacamole with so much raw onion in it that it, too, was virtually inedible. Why was that place packed? I really don't get it. Please explain. Oh, yeah, and the manager came and asked, "Was our food great?" Uh, no, not really, but since he didn't ask in a way that I could actually answer him, and dashed off quickly, I didn't tell the truth. Please, people, there's Thasos Greek right there, and a good Cuban place and a fish taco place nearby. Support your local independent restaurants and don't patronize this swill. I will never go back to a Red Robin again.

I LOVE this location.  We walked in right before the dinner crowed and got seated right away.  Wish I could remember our servers name, she was great. To start we got the chips, dip, and salsa. We had no idea that the chips are able to be refilled. Made us very happy.  We came in a group of 4. 2 of us ordered the burger with the egg, loved it, no complaints from them. The other ordered the burger with blue cheese and of course was happy as well. I ordered the new Smoke and Pepper Signature Burger. It was everything I thought it would be and more. Made me so happy. It was exactly how I imagined it would taste. I LOVE pepper and bacon so it was like they made it specifically for me. Though it may be a bit pricey for a burger, I'm all over it. Not a care in the world. Totally hooked on this burger. Really hope they keep it on the menu,  The customer service was great by the way. Loved it. Even the release waitress for us when ours went on break, she was great as well. Always making sure our drinks were taken care of. I seriously love this location. Its perfect.

My husband and I went here recently for his birthday! He has the Red Robin card that gets him little perks here and there. So, he decided that he wanted to redeem his birthday burger perk and we did the healthy thing and bicycled over from the house which is less than 7 miles away. When we got there, we were seated right away and the server showed up so promptly! Thank you very much Andrew we appreciate the level of service that you gave us! We started with a couple of drinks and then got right on to the burger ordering once hubby made up his mind on which one he wanted. He decided on the Whiskey burger they had there because it is one you don't get often elsewhere. I went with my usual Teriyaki Chicken Burger.Awesome stuff! Just as good as any other time we had gone in the past. We left feeling quite full and very satisfied with everything we ordered! If anyone goes anytime soon please ask for a very nice man named Andrew! He's awesome!

It has been a long time since I have eaten here. I decided to stop in here after shopping and grab a quick burger.  The place was pretty packed so I decided to grab a seat at the bar. It took a bit for someone to ask me what I would like to drink, as one of the girls at the bar was telling her life story to one of the patrons sitting next to me and didn't even stop to acknowledge me when I sat down.  I decided to have the bacon guacamole burger.  The burger took awhile to arrive, but it was worth the wait. The burger was juicy and tasty. I ordered it medium and it came out with a touch of pink, perfectly cooked. The steak fries were lukewarm and tasted like they had been sitting for a bit before they arrived in a silver cup they toss their fries into.  They do offer bottomless fries with their burgers, but I struggled to get through what I had.  I think I would just order a side salad next time and pass on the fries.

- Locale Destination -  It's on W. Sunflower and Bristol St in Santa Ana.  It's in a big shopping plaza across from South Coast Plaza/ parking, next to "Cost Plus". It's kinda big unlike outside look. It's like a sports bar - this was my first visit, ok? Lots of TVs for games and a good size bar. Service is pretty slow. Plenty of parking.  The menu is a bit confusing.. They have not only burgers (included vegetarian options), but also sandwiches and salads. I'm the first timer here, so don't ask me much.  - Burgers on "Lunch menu" is smaller than regular size on "burger section".  - Gluttony Expedition -  Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger: lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, onions, mayo & reds pickle relish. you choose your  cheese: cheddar, american, swiss, bleu, provolone or pepper-jack. I avoided it since I wanted to enjoy "bottomless fries".  Bottomless fries: I guess it means "free refill", yet it won't work well if the server came here to check up on me....;( - Conqueror's Deduction -  It's decent. I'm not so sure what's "gourmet" about this..

I love this restaurant... it's my first option when thinking hamburgers... but  I was very disappointing on new years, we all went there and ordered our food...  I did not like it!!... it was dry so I felt I was eating a cardboard hamburger... I even thought I got and "old" burger not just made... first time it happen to me, hopefully next time I go everything is as delicious as I know their food is.... service was great as always...

Food was excellent.  Great burger joint.  I had the Smoked Pepper burger.  Sooooo good! Big portions, delicious flavor.  My complements to the chef. Besides the delicious food, tonight the service was especially extraordinary.  Courtney,  our server,  was outstanding.  We are a family of four with two young children.  As is typical, kids will be kids.  Long story short,  Courtney went out of her way to make my family feel welcome. Or maybe she didn't, maybe she's just a natural.  Thanks Courtney.  We will be back.

Alex is the best bartender! Always remembers my usual!!! Food is always delish! The fish and chips is better than most and there's a reason they're known for their burgers... my fave the Royal. Happy hour on Sunday is 8 to close...

Let's get one thing straight,  I visit Red Robin only when it's the kids' turn to pick our dinner restaurant. Our usual RR is the one on Katella, but tonight, this location was closer to us. Yay for us. Starting with the positive: I actually enjoy most of the food at the other location RR, and the selections we sampled at this one generally seemed on par (except for the no-cheese mac n cheese -- bleh). It is clean and the servers are friendly. I really liked my sloppy mess of a Chophouse burger, and even the bun was pretty nice (soft, dense, with just the right hint of toastines on the edges). The outlier in our group who ordered Clucks (chicken tenders) reported satisfaction.  And the rest: Service was inexplicably slow for a non-holiday, Thursday night. The restaurant wasn't busy by any means, but gradually filled up after we had been seated and our orders taken. Then, we got to watch the same later-seated tables served their food about 15 minutes before ours appeared. The Smoke N Pepper burger (13$) was perhaps slightly better than a Carl's Jr. Six dollar burger. Our single salted caramel "Monster" shake didn't arrive until after most of our meal was finished, and then only after a succession of inquiries had been made of more than one passing staff. Something had mysteriously transformed all the salted caramel flavoring back to vanilla -- theoretically,  the same rift in the fabric of time and space which delayed our food at the pass, also might have triggered a magnetic field at the bar, which reverse-engineered the caramelian molecules until they had expired. And it was a *midget* monster shake at that, durnit. I'd call it 12 oz of actual shake content, tops.  Of note: when they ask if you want your burgers with "some pink" it means medium. We all three burger people ordered "some pink" and received patties that were completely browned through. Why did they bother asking in the first place? We ate them anyway because it was getting late and we were getting desperate for food. Also note that while our burgers literally came with containers of steak fries that were bottomless, these were not refilled once. In all, it wasn't a complete failure, but this visit to the Costa Mesa RR location did not make a good enough impression to prompt future visits. The birthday child was sternly warned that when Grandma and Grandpa came from out of town to take us to Birthday Dinner Part 2 on Sunday, he was to choose another restaurant. Preferably, Polly's.

Go here for lunch, but forget it during dinner hours. Lunch: My boyfriend and I were treated with great and fast service and the food was delicious! Dinner: We have tried this place numerous times for dinner. Three times we have had to walk out because we were seated for about 20 minutes, the server asked for our drink order, and disappeared. Our most recent experience (third time) was last weekend. This is the first time we sat in the bar area where we were told we will get "full service" to eat dinner and order drinks... More like no service. It looked as if one server was assigned to ten tables. We waited about 15 minutes to get our menus. We walked out shortly after. I think there is a management issue here. Bad deployment and understaffed.

I actually had a nice experience at this Red Robin. I sat at the bar as there was a 40 minute wait for a table- completely unacceptable. I sat at the bar about 7 mins before even being acknowledged! Kinda ridiculous. Never the less, I ordered my whiskey bbq turkey burger...arrived fairly quickly and very tasty as usual. My issue these days with Red Robin- that although there are bottomless fries,they give you very little. I assume this is a selling tactic to not waste, but they give you about a servings' worth of fries and you almost always ask for more. The bar does leave it less for you to have a more personable dining experience, but its all relative.  I did have the red velvet cake for dessert and it was actually really good. Otherwise, this is not my best Red Robin experience, I think the one at the Spectrum boasts a better experience. The one at Tustin District is second, this one ranks third. The best thing about this location is the shopping right across the street...but the Spectrum trumps that too.

Let me start off by saying, i usually always tip, it is rare for me to not tip because i used to work in the food industry and i know how that feels when someone doesnt tip. I did not provide a tip, the waitress did not deserve it. We first came in and were seated, and then we told our waitress we wanted fries and two drinks, 10 min goes by and the waitress asks what we want to eat while handing us our drinks, we ask for a few more min. Another 10 min goes by until we get a plate of fries and our drinks are empty. We order our food and you'd think she'd notice that our drinks were completely empty. Nope. We get our food about 20 min after we ordered and she failed to bring us a refill. I asked her for a refill and she walks away, and i said, "Well ok, bye!", I have to ask another waitress to get us refills, i ordered a ghost chilli burger so a cold drink would be preferred. Takes forever to receive the drinks again, and they are half ass compared to the first ones. Food was good, the burger was definitely worth the price but not at the cost of the service. Maybe she was having an off day but poor service really grinds my gears, when i worked with food i always made sure to give my full attention and provide excellent customer service no matter what mood i was in, so i feel that you are not entitled to a tip, you need to uphold your part of your job.

This is my favorite RED ROBIN location!! I love Red Robin's food! I have been to many different locations but this is the one I stick too. My friend was visiting so we decided to come here and we made it for happy hour but I ended up drinking a soda lol We come here often I ordered the Reds Tavern yum yum The waitress was awesome because i always eat my fries with ranch and she gave me samples of the dipping sauces so i could try them and that was amazing because now I know what I like and which ones I dont. Trust me, dip the fries w ranch so good &&& if your feeling extra adventurous season them with the seasoning thats on the table or ask for it. YUMM YUMM YUMM The waitress was pretty cool and the atmosphere here was cool - we sat away from the bar.

Get the Royal Red Robin Burger, it has a fried egg on it! I've also had their salads and sandwiches and everything is very good. For the bottomless fries, you have to actually ask for a refill people, the servers won't just give you one since it could be a waste of food. I've noticed recently though that some of the servers are nicer to one table more than the other. I'm not sure why that could be, but the managers need to do something about it because it's very annoying to see the table next to you get constant water refills and a smile while we barely get checked on and have grumpiness.

I have a favorite here and that would be the Crispy Chicken Burger, closely followed by Burnin' Love substituted with chicken.  There's just something about the first sandwich that makes me keep coming back to it.  The sodas are bad, unfortunately :(  And also the drinks aren't that good, either, but whatever.  I'm not expecting anything to really wow me here.  The last time I had my favorite sandwich, though, my stomach was killing me as I was eating it.  I chalked it up to old age :/  I said I would never eat it again, but that's a lie.  It seems as though the last few times we've been here the fries have been burnt. My boyfriend loves the Whisky River BBQ sandwich and also the Buffalo Clucks and Fries.  It's hard for him to get anything else as well! All in all, it's a good place to go when you're hungry and don't want something too expensive.
Came in for lunch. Sat in the bar area. Food came out fast. Waitress was really friendly and attentive.  Burgers are okay. Love the bottomless steak fries and freckled lemonade.

Sat for 10 minutes in the bar with a friend, wasn't spoken to once besides droppinoff menus and saying brb, we then watched the Asian spiked hair guy waiter go to the table next to us 4 times, checkin up on them and putting more rounds in for them on drinks, which wAs odd.  We watched him also go to another table who sat down 5 minutes after us to take their order.   Fail at customer service. Cause it wasn't even very busy.

This Red Robin is actually pretty snazzy, food is good and so are the fries. Not my favorite place to go but it's a nice alternative to go if plans fall apart or people can't come up with a solution on where to eat.

HORRIBLE SERVICE !!! Waited 20 minutes for my margarita ...had a party of 9 constantly waiting for refills. Brought half the food out first ...never coming back. Server looked like she didn't want to be here

I would of given it 5 stars but the burger was just bland.  Upon arrival we were greeted with a good afternoon and a smile. Decided to sit in the bar section which was alright, there were 2 drunk ladies in the table next to is that truly made our evening hilarious.  Service was great. Our waitress came to check on us constantly.  The atmosphere was great but the food not so much.

I love their burgers and fires! But the service here is not great. I have been multiple times and the food is always great, but it always takes forever to get anything. Make sure if you want a fry refill ask for it when they drop off your food. Today after the waitress dropped off the check I had to flag down the manager to take care of it cause she disappeared. So be warned!

I placed a to-go order for myself and 4 co-workers. The person taking my order argued with me about the difference between a sauce and an aioli. When I picked up my order the forgot the honey mustard, and there was a 2 inch black hair on my chicken sandwich. Not going back to this location.

I normally enjoy Red Robin burger as their burgers are unique and creatively consistent every time but lately their service at this location has been suffering. We came at a non peak time to avoid the dinner rush but ended up waiting for our waiter way too long, so we had no choice but to go to Burger Stop instead (which is never disappointing by the way). The odd thing I saw the manager going back and forth and not even asking us how we are doing or if they can perhaps take our drink order. I like their food but I don't think I will go back until management overhauls their service and/or staffing levels.

The service is so bad you'll think you're on candid camera.  My father lives in another country & visits once a year. He likes the burgers here so we bring him every time he visits. Even without him, we sometimes come for a casual meal in the bar. The service is consistently slow even if the place is empty. Last year when we brought my dad the service was awful. We were seated without menus, we got our own, the waitress took forever to show up & seemed peeved when she took our drink orders & we indicated we wanted to place our food orders too. Once the food arrived we needed utensils & refills, but she never came back with them. We flagged down another staff member who instead of getting us what we needed offered to find us our server who took more time to bring us what we needed. We also had to wait an extended period of time for our server to appear so we could flag her down to ask for the bill & then waited again for her to take forever to bring it over. This year during my dad's visit we went in with low expectations. Once we were seated and given menus true to form we were completely ignored. After about 10 minutes of no one coming over, I asked the host if we could get a server. Another 10 minutes later the host showed up & asked if he could get us drinks. Let me add that at this point other tables were also totally being ignored. Then, a manager walked by, I hoped he was going to notice what was going on & ask if we needed anything, but he just walked right past us oblivious to our existence. That was the last straw, we decided to leave instead of waste more time waiting around for the server who clearly had zero intentions to show up. As we got up to leave the host showed up with our iced teas. (We had the first table by the host stand) As we were leaving our table and crossing the host stand announcing why we were leaving the manager walked towards us AGAIN completely oblivious to what was happening, in fact he walked out WITH US to the parking lot & jogged over clearly to what was more important than his job. With such a disinterested manager it's no wonder his servers are MIA!

Red Robin isn't often a place I go to if I'm craving a burger. But I love their fries and seasoning salt. If I'm coming here it's usually with people who want to go, rarely it's my first choice as a place for an overpriced burger. With that being said, their burgers are decent and the service here is good.
Garbage service!!!! Come on guys don't forget that we're here. Food was meh.

This place is just so out of education. The servers don't know nothing about costumer service! My brother and I came here for dinner, we decided to sit at the bar to be seated sooner. We sat there for about 10 minutes nobody would come in to assists us. Until then someone came and took our drink order, brought it and took off didn't even take our order. Never came back! Guess the bartender was our server she took our order and just left. My brother wanted to get some bottomless fries, server was passing by a young lady. He caught her attention not even bothering to ask if we were doing fine! He ask if we could have a basket of fries and she seriously did not know what we were talking about like seriously? She left to talk to someone and she came back and she was like uhh I don't think your order is ready yet and just said sorry and took off. Then our food came in. For the whole time we ate no one stop by to ask how we were doing. Our server the bartender was instead talking to this guy making him drinks and not pay attention to us at all. My brother was seriously upset the way we were treated. He really wanted to talk to a maneger because this kind of service is just unacceptable but from we saw there was seem to be no manager. We both are in the costumer service industry. I work at a hotel and I know how much a guest loves to feel welcomed and specail so they're stay can be extraordinary  so I put extra attention to them. Which it was nothing how I experienced in this restaurant. Never again coming to this restaurant.

I've always liked this chain.  The burgers are decent, but it's the fries that get you!  Endless steak fries are great with their seasoning.  I've always had great service at all the different locations I've been in.  They also have a members reward card which is free to sign up for and you can discounts on your meals. Overall, a good burger place, great fries and really good service.  Great place to bring kids too.

Love all Red Robins! They have the best fries ever, made exponentially better by the fact that they are bottomless! My favorites items here are the Teriyaki Chicken Burger (I love me some pineapple!), the Crispy Chicken Tender Salad (the honey mustard dressing is awesome), and the Rookie Magic (an oreo shake).  4 stars is all for the food. The service is normal hit or miss, sometimes you get a great waiter/waitress and sometimes you have to hunt them down for a refill when your soda's been empty for the last 15 minutes. It is what it is, I'm there for the food. :)

So, my girlfriend wanted to take me to lunch. We were set on Ruby's or Muldoons, and driving from a pretty good distant. My pops gave me a coupon for a 1/2 off burger to Red Robin. I thought, hell why not I haven't been there in a while. The service was fine and the food was fine but then when we put the coupon on the end of the meal we were told it expired yesterday. I was super bummed. The only reason we took the extra 10 mile trip was BECAUSE of this coupon. I talked with the General Manager, who was nice enough, but didn't understand what customer service was all about. Bullet points: Wanted to go somewhere else to start. Had a coupon that saved us $4.50 on our $40 dollar meal. Coupon was expired. Manager was contacted. Was told that there was literally nothing he could do. Safe to say, I will never return to Red Robin. All over $4.50 that the manager wouldn't comp because of a coupon that expired 12 hours ago. Pathetic customer service.

The food is burgers are great. Also you can not beat bottom-less fries and drinks. Most reviews got the a service is a hit or miss and I have to agree. The last time it would take a little bit to get a refill on my fries and drink. I also ordered bottom less sweet potatoes fries and those took forever to get out. Other than that it's a good go to burger fix place.

So, just left this place after placing an order and waiting for an hour and getting nothing but a glass of water and one drink. Not one person ever checked with us, offered a refill, asked us how we were enjoying the hot nothing that we were never served or ever bothered with us in any way after our intial order was taken. People came in after we did, placed orders, were served, ate their meals and were asking for their checks while we still sat there watching the ice melt in our long empty drinks. My bf finally cornered the waiter and told him that we needed to leave as he had to get back to jury duty and if we didn't have our food in literally two minutes, we were leaving. Never saw the waiter again and walked out, hungry and annoyed five minutes later. I don't think we will ever be back, especially if we have less than two hours for lunch.
Red Robin has the best onion rings! The combination with my Cali chicken sandwich, packed all my bites with heavy flavors! Overall, it was a hearty meal!

Honestly, the food is really expensive for what you are getting quality-wise. Onion rings were decent, burger was decent. I wouldnt say its gourmet, just that its bigger, has more meat, and more stuff like the guacamole bacon burger i got. As for the taste, I wouldve settled for In n Out which is 70% cheaper and tastes just as good, if not better, what with its simplicity. Fries are good though! haha

I have mixed feelings about Red Robin.   I would give them a 4 for their food which is usually really good. On occasion they have brought out the burgers rare on one half and medium well on the other.  Not sure how they manage that as it is cooked on a conveyor belt. The service that has problems.  Most of the waitresses have been exceptional.  The hostesses are often a problem.  When asked how long the wait is, we are told about 15 minutes.  when it was getting close to 15 minutes, I asked if we were almost up and ws told it would likely be another 20 minutes.  Really?  they've been in business long enough to figure the wait much better than that.  I also handed the girl my "Reward" card and asked if I had any rewards available.  She had to go get the manager who came out and explained that it was a reward card not a gift card.  Daaaah.  I know that!  That is why I asked if there were any "Rewards" available. I did get two rewards in my email last week.  One for a birthday burger and the other for a free desert.  The problem is that I had one week to use both of them and you can only use one at a time.  the manager said he could do nothing about that.  Guess he isn't aware that a manager always has the ability to use managers discretion.  The dessert would have cost them less than loosing a customer or have an unhappy customer go tell the story on the Internet. Bottom line ....  Food 4 ... Customer Service 2.

Let me preface my review by saying that I adore Red Robin restaurants.  I eat there often, get take out from there often and have frequented many locations.  While the waiter was excellent at this location, everything else was so disappointing that I won't be returning.  No greeting or even a person at the desk when we arrived.  They seemed to be running around trying to set up a big table for a soccer team of girls. That was ok, we did get seated eventually.  I noticed not only was the table sticky but all the menu pages were as well which grosses me out.  The floor looked like it hadn't been cleaned in days and there was actually a fry on the elevated shelf between the booths, right at eye level.  So I ordered one of my go-to menu items, the souper sandwich combo.  My favorite chicken tortilla soup and a caeser chicken wrap.  Took some time for the food to come.  I have eaten this soup for years and know exactly what it should taste like. This was a cup of dishwater with some vegetables in it, not much chicken, not even the right color or consistency!  I took a couple of bites and could not continue.  My caeser wrap was mostly dry greens, perhaps a tablespoon of chicken in each half.  So very sad.  I have never before left a Red Robin location hungry.

Server was very slow and my order was prepared wrong. I paid extra for the pig out and ghost sauce. When I told the server there was no ghost sauce she went to the cook and asked if he added the sauce.  She came back ad said that the cook said that he put the sauce on the bottom bun. I guess I was lying. I will never eat there again. I was charged for both extras.

Quality and service has never been sub par, every time I've visited I've been greeted with smiles,welcomes&good food. I'm a burger enthusiast and Red Robin definitely impresses me when it comes to their burgers, in n out pales in comparison not only in the variety of their burgers but also in their quality. My only complain would be coming in on a busy weekend & not getting a seat for 30 minutes & getting what should've been a med well burger well done...even then I left satisfied.

I really used to love Red Robin... I'm talking eating here for lunch, dinner, several times a month. But, alas, that day has come and gone. Ever since the new menu / style revamp their service has more or less declined. Food quality and quantity have taken a dive too. Maybe caught them on a bad day? It took our waitress tonight ten minutes after being seated just to introduce herself and ask us for our drinks... I ordered chili cheese fries and my friend got fish and chips. The fish and chips was really good, a tad pricey at $12.99 though for what you get... The chili cheese fries were pathetic. I guess their ideal chili is one that has no sauce whatsoever and is basically baked on top of the fries. Also, in the menu it says it's served with a side of ranch... We had to ask for the ranch. C'mon Red Robin! Know your menu! Red Robin needs to learn from Farrel's Ice Cream Parlour, chili cheese fries means saucy, piled on, chili and cheese, not baked ground beef and cheese sprinkled with bacon on top of fries.  Thankfully the waitress didn't put up a fight when I asked her to take it off the tab. (We barely ate it)  Knit picking here, but the waitress also never really checked up on us, didn't offer to refill my water till we were basically finished.  Paying our bill took a long time too. Another ten minutes waiting for that. I also asked about their gift card promo that comes with a movie ticket and they said the gift card can't be used till six hours after purchase. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!?! Since when does it ever take six hours to load a gift card?!?! Plus the hostess said we could purchase and use it the same night.  Red Robin, either serve your guests 100% or continue being like 90% of Orange County who nickel and dime / tease customers with offers. "Free stuff! But there's a catch!"  Anyways, there really used to be wonderful waiters and waitresses here, they were all gone tonight sadly. They were awesome, they could take your order without writing anything down. Refilled your drinks without asking and checked on you regularly, but not overly much.  So the fish and chips are really good and that's how our experience went tonight.  What happened to you Red Robin? :'(
One of my favorite locations. Never too busy when I go and there are never any hiccups with my orders.  Great food and great service!

I love Red Robin.  Their fried chicken sandwich is my favorite.  Pair it with a delicious Guinness and Jameson chocolate milkshake and I am in cardiac arrest heaven!  Let me not forget about the bottomless fries.  They have options for Vegans, Vegetarians, omnivores, carnivores, herbivores, gluten free, Paleo, Atkins, you name it, I am sure they will accommodate you. I am a picky person with some picky friends.  We are always accommodated, taken care of, and treated with a friendly smile.

Red Robins is located on Sunflower right next to World Market and Ross across from South Coast Plaza. Red Robbin is Best known for their burgers. When you walk in the you are greeted by a friendly hostess and they seat you right away. No wait time which is nice. They have a full bar with TV's all over or they have the regular dining area with comfy booths. The decor is unique they have movie poster everywhere. I don't think there are any blank spaces on the walls.  The servers are all very nice and nice looking. They have a pretty big menu with a lot of different types of burgers. I was a little disappointed that they didn't have a monster burger or some outrageous burger challenge. I mean a place best known for burgers should have some gigantic burger. I tried to order the biggest thing i could find on the menu which was the Signature burger called The Colossus for the Hercules Movie. In my opinion this was a pretty sad burger so I added a patty to beef it up so it could live up to its name. The Triple Colossus! When the burger came out i was like dude this is like a regular burger. I seriously could have ate another one. As for the flavors of it nothing special. That's the problem i have with this Burger joint. There's nothing special about them. For that amount of money Id rather eat at Slater 50/50 and be in burger heaven. My Boss said he like his burger but again nothing special. The also ordered endless french fries. They were alright. Overall the food was good but definitely not my first choice when it comes to eating burgers. They need to do something different. Spruce it up! Thanks for reading my review. - Matt

Warning I Was Really hungry when i came to eat here so idk if that might reflect my review but here goes. Host said 15 mins wait turned into 25mins thats fine it was pretty busy dodger vs angels game was on. When finally got seated the light at are table wasnt on. the host left and it took 10 mins to get water from a waitress who wasnt even are section. we were ready to order by then so me and my three homies placed the burger orders the food came out pretty fast not too long of wait but we didnt even have any forks or napkins until half way thru the meal. i also noticed my bottom bun of my burger was a bit soggy so might of been sitting a while not cool. my homie ordered a dr pepper first one was fine but when he ordered his second it came out FLAT?  I dont blame this on the host or waitres more of the management side of things to have more staff and also to make sure certain people take care of certain jobs FYI the soda. busy days suck but its not like its the first opening day at red robbins
Excellent service! We have been coming here for years & never been disappointed. Friendly staff, the wait is never too long. I highly recommend it. Their milkshakes are delicious too!

Island's or Red Robin?  This seems to be an endless question with no definite answers.  But Red Robin wins this round hands down. I haven't been to a Red Robin in a while and was pleasantly surprised when I tried this location for the first time.  I ordered the Keep It Simple burger and was very impressed by both its presentation and its taste.  The fire-grilled patty looked awesome and the presentation was pretty (see picture).  Fire-grilled with a criss-cross pattern burnt on the patty and with pink juices oozing out, this is as good as a burger could look!  One bite and I was in love with it.  Perfectly medium as I ordered, juicy, and flavorful - this was good.  I mean GOOD!  This burger completely changed my impression of Red Robin.  Haven't been to one in a while, but now I may be going there often! The fries were prefect.  Perfectly golden brown and crispy on the outside and slightly starchy inside - YUM!.  And they were fresh from the fryer!  When you pick them up with your fingers, they will slightly burn your fingertips.  If you are not careful, you'll burn your tongue.  This is exactly how French fries are supposed to be served.  And how can you not order another serving of their bottomless fries?  If there's a knockout punch, this is it.  The second serving of fries was as perfect as the first one.  That's consistent execution. Service was good.  Although the hostess was a bit robotic, my server has been really cool and upbeat and exuded enthusiasm in her work.  Service has been prompt and attentive. Overall, Red Robin beats Island's with a TKO this round.

This was the second time I went to this place and boy was it a disappointment.  I got the bleu cheese burger and wings and chips for the appetizers. the restaurant was freezing in our section but our server was nice enough to turn up the heat for us... the food was cold the burger was bleh the fries were old, everything was kinda sub par minus the server our waiter was nice but the food server was forgetful asked him for ranch and he totally forgets... will not frequent this red robin again, will go to a different location if i feel like it

We were craving for ice cold drinks and yummy burgers and decided to go here since it's been awhile. Even though this is one of our top burger places, we almost never decide to come because of the shitty service they provide. We sat at the bar for about 10minutes and were never approached by a server/waitress with any kind of attention, like a "Hi, I'll be right with you" or "Hi! Let me get your server", so we decided to move get seated in the regular dining area. We got seated right away by the moody hostess. As soon as we sat down, this hostess kept wiping down the children's high chairs and placed them (in a banging manner) in the area behind where we were seated (how annoying!). Another 10 minutes had passed without being recognized and we decided to leave. Wow. I commend you Red Robin for having the poorest customer service I have ever known! Luckily one of our favorite restaurants was just one street away.
This location has always been good for me. I used to live near by. My fav is the Royal Red Robin.

I really only come here when the boyfriend needs to watch a game and since I don't currently own a TV, Red Robin is perfect for us. It's down the street from my house, they have burgers at a reasonable price, and drinks. We've only been here twice so far and both times we decided to seat ourselves in the bar area because we need to be surrounded by TVs, I guess.  Both times the service has been good. This last time we sat at the actual bar so the bartender was always on top of our drink and food orders. I ordered the Royal Robin Burger with the sunny-side up egg...I probably won't get that again only because it was so messy; I didn't even finish it. It tasted OK otherwise. Lots of cheese. This definitely is not a diet-friendly burger! The boyfriend ordered a French dip sandwich and he seemed OK with it; he finished the sandwich.  The fries are bottomless, which is a major plus for me!

I am torn between a three and a four. I have a lot of good things but there are a few bad things that make or break it. I frequent the bar at least once a week to watch football. Let me just start off by saying that I have not yet met a staff member that is rude or doesn't care about what they are doing. Always very helpful even if they are not serving your table. I have not had a bad meal and they always keep my drink refilled. A lot of the times the bar tender remembers what I eat and asks me if that is what I will be having for the night. The bad is, the drinks are expensive and the happy hour is not very appealing. They only have it on a few drinks instead of all of them. They do not have military discounts but they have a mall employee discount. Other than that it is a good atmosphere and I would recommend anyone to stop by and grab a cold one.

The place is great, prices are fair, food is fresh, service is awesome. Id only suggest they not wait for the center to improve and go ahead and fix up your outside. From the parking lot this place looks aweful. Once inside its very nice. You need to show the very nice to the people driving by.
