Great burgers at a reasonable price. Gotta try the Burning Love (or something like that). Customer service was ok. Waited for about 40 min just to sit a party of 4 when there were lots of available tables. Have no idea why they wouldn't use those ones. The server was on point; could've had a better sense of humor. Their Cadillac margaritas are bomb. Good music too.

UPDATE:  Manager named Katie messaged me on Yelp saying she wanted to follow-up and asking for my contact info. Gave her my number. Six-ish weeks have passed. Haven't heard a peep. Might have given this place a second chance ... but no longer. It would've been better for her not to contact me at all than to reach out, then not follow-up or deliver.

I ate here last night at about 10:40 pm and ordered a burger.  The burger was not very good quality.  The cheese looked like it had been microwaved on and even worse, the bacon was rubbery and pale looking, it had obviously been microwaved.  Bacon should be crispy, not plasticy feeling.  I feel like they rushed making my burger because it was close to closing time. I could have got a better burger from wendy's so I was very disappointed.  Im giving this three stars because the wings were good and my server was very good.  I didn't complain inside the restaurant because it was late and they were about to close, plus I don't think I should have to tell a restaurant that specializes in burgers how to make one.

I've been to many Red Robins, but this must be the WORST RED ROBIN EVER. Context: I used to go to Red Robin all the time, because of great burgers, short wait times, and friendly and thorough service. I never gave less than 20% tip because the experiences were so phenomenal. This location may have turned me off to Red Robin altogether. There was a 20 min wait to get seated even before 6pm, even though there were empty seats. I didn't even know who my server was in the beginning because my server never showed and another server helped him out. My drinks wasn't filled, my burgers showed up before my appetizer (which I cancelled), and for 20 mins I couldn't find my server to get an extra basket full of fries or get the bill. To be fair, the server was nice in the 3 times I saw him anywhere within the vicinity of our table during the an hour and twenty minutes we were at the restaurant. Trying to proxy through another server was also difficult because they either relay back to the original server, or avoid eye contact altogether because they're not serving me (mostly the latter). We also sat in a location where two of the lights above us were broken. So the corner was kind of dark. The seat was also a little dirty. Seems like they didn't take care of their facilities very well either. Will never return to this location, or maybe even Red Robins in general, after this experience.

I haven't been to Red Robins since my last bad experience with the Irvine location. I was shopping in the area and decided to give them a try again. When I got there it was pretty busy but the wait was only about 5 minutes.  We ordered the Royal Red Robin burger minus tomatoes, Prime Chophouse, and 2 Kid's Chicken Strips basket. The burgers were cooked the way I requested.  Our waitress (Jordan) was really nice and attentive.

If you are gluten-intolerant don't go to this location. Tried to place a take-out order and thought we should confirm that they had gluten-free french fries (other Red Robin locations do). The response we received was simply "oh, I don't think so."  No offer to check. If their staff is too stupid to know their menu, and too lazy to check, I don't want to eat there. Would advise you look at another Red Robin location too.

Normally, I don't write reviews for restaurants unless I've had a horrible experience there. And if I'm going somewhere already you'll already know that it's because it's known for being great! But this time I'm actually going to write a good review because the customer service here was excellent! Better than anywhere I've been in awhile. I've been to Red Robin before with my family and the only thing I remembered about the experience was the onion rings tower.  But this time I had a birthday coupon so I thought why not? I went with my boyfriend and it was during the lunch rush so we ended up sitting at the bar. There was one waitress and it was a full house so it took a while before we could order. The waitress was doing an excellent job though. She was engaging and joking with customers. It was admirable the way she was handling the bar area by herself. So we ordered and we were pretty patient even though people who ordered after us were getting their food already. We ended up sitting there for 30 minutes or more but I was having a good time talking to my boyfriend so I didn't mind. (Usually I would be really mad) Also the waitress would come up to us reassuring us about the food and telling us she yelled at the cooks for us so that helped. We ended up getting our food after our waitress let one of the managers or host not sure, that her bar area wasn't getting food on time because of a technical problem with the computers and people were blaming her. And she mentioned us in the conversation. It was funny because we weren't even mad but I appreciated her showing us she genuinely did care. After that we got our food, everyone was really helpful. For example, right after we asked for more fries they would bring it over in under a minute. BRAVO TO YOU RED ROBIN. Our waitress also forgot about the birthday coupon so we asked the host and she also gave us 25% off for the wait and a birthday sundae! Normally restaurants don't give my boyfriend and I customer service this amazing and to think they were all so nice just because we had to wait a little and we weren't even mad about it! There are some reviews on yelp about bad customer service here but I really enjoyed my experience and I hope the rest of the people who come to the restaurant is greeted with the same service. The burgers weren't quite memorable but I do suggest the onion ring tower. It's delicious!

Very disappointed in my experience last night. Service was lacking (maybe our server was new & needs more training) & so were the "bottomless" fries. I'll def refrain from coming here again on the weekends!

Red robin isn't exactly great...  I was hoping this place would be good based on a recommendation from a friend, but as it turns out, I felt sick after eating their food.  The place was dirty and the food was slimy and bland.  The bathroom was also messy.  I tried to create a healthy option by doing a burger in a lettuce wrap, but it ended up slimy and bland.  I will not be coming back :-/
Great burgers love the endless fries. They have a great happy hour menu. Will be coming back.
I love the bottomless fries here with honey mustard.  I also normally get the royal red burger with a little bit of pink. Also going to try that cronut tower next time if I have room.
I really like some of their Burgers.My personal fav is Burning Love though! It is very yummy and especially with the Sweet potato fries served with ranch dressing!

Worst red robin around Orange County. Service was really poor and seating time was long especially for it not even being a busy night. Server didn't approach table for about 15 minutes after being seated.
endless fries and root beer floats baby!

Last night I order burger .notthing good the burger is so cold look like they made that long time and I wait too long for table and food . I let the manager know about my story but she doesn't say any thing .i never come back there any more

***Credit Card Theft*** Be very careful with your credit card at this location! Server took orders and delivered food swiftly and accurately  Server presented bill and I laid my credit card on the bill which was picked up by a nameless female who was not my server Charge slip for me to sign was returned to our table but not my credit card Asked about card and was told they didn't have it Canceled card  Won't ever return to this location again +++++UPDATE+++ Someone claiming to be from Red Robin messaged me in response to this yelp posting This person claimed that Red Robin would contact me withn two days I have yet to be contacted by anybody regarding the theft/loss of my credit card a week after the occurrence

I had gone to the Red Robin at Irvine Spectrum and had a pleasant experience so I wanted to give this place a chance. It wasn't packed or anything. As we walk in the server asks us how many people and if we would mind sitting by the bar, we didn't mind. As we answered her she just handed us our menus and that was it. We went to sit ourselves and we had to guess which table she meant. It was empty but our food took forever. The waitress only came over three times to take our order to give us the bill and after being called. The whole time our server was at the bar flirting with one guy. We didn't have any ketchup or napkins at our table and since our server was busy at the bar she didn't pay attention to us at all. We were ignored the whole time, extremely bad customer service. Not returning here again.

I love burgers red robin is awesome but man this place is crazy this is my go to location but sometimes they get it right and most times they don't   Well done please Bloody burger No mayo please  Mayo like their is no tomorrow Can I up grade They forget to give me the upgrade So today I go in and is 3:10 pm no body is their but me and some other tables and guess what they messed up my order again AGAIN really why I don't understand it when is busy they say is because they are busy and when is not BUSY WHATS THE EXCUSE I don't get it but they are getting go the point where I might have to stop going here for ever I have done this before so TACO BELL guess what I have never been back again RED ROBBIN YOUR TESTING ME

We eat at this restaurant on a regular basis and love their food and atmosphere.  The burgers and fries are delicious with the Red Robin seasoning salt.  The onion rings are crunchy with a good flavor.  Hard to resist!  Very friend staff with good service. Nice family atmosphere.

Stopped in for my birthday lunch. I ordered the fish sandwhich. I had to send it back twice the bun was so soggy you could not even pick the sandwhich up to eat it. I also ordered a side salad and it had wilted lettuce in it. I was very disappointed. The waitress was very good and felt bad and the manager took care of the check which is good because I did not get to eat it. Very disappointing. I am giving 2 stars for the waitress.

The reason im writing this review is because this is my 4th visit to this red robin ( I work right around the corner) and I thought I'd give them the benefit of the doubt. But...this restaurant proved once again to have terrible service. What I mean by this is, they are very slow, unattentive & unorganized. They seat you and literally forget about you, I always have to go hunt down my waiter , ask for my order to be taken and ask for utensils. Whoever is managing this floor needs a manager , corporate needs to send a "secret shopper" so they can experience what I have.
Went out for my cousin's birthday during lunch time on a Saturday.  The place wasn't packed which was nice.  Service was good and the place clean.

I had a very negative experience at the Santa Ana, CA location. I am gluten-free and was treated like a second class citizen. The gluten-free menu is only online and the hostess could not even provide me with a scan code to find the site. The manager was less than courteous. He did offer for me to use the store IPAD to find the menu but walked away without explaining how to use it. Several staff members tried to find the scan code and opened draws and cabinets looking for it. If the kitchen is half as chaotic and messy as the storage areas in front then  I am glad I did not eat there. We left without eating there because if they can't even provide me with a gluten-free  menu then how can the cook me a safe meal.

Very impressed with our Valentine's Day experience. My 3 year old daughter and I went out on a "date" and RR was her choice.  To begin with, she didn't want a regular menu item. She wanted carrots, broccoli, and oranges. The waitress said, no problem, we can make it happen.  The burger was cooked just how I asked and without the items I didn't want on it. Fries were hot and refilled promptly when asked.  Freckles lemonade is excellent! As we were nearing the end of our meal, the manager approached and asked if we would like some ice cream. A few minutes later, she came back with a sundae on the house. She expressed that she glad to see a dad spending time with his daughter and this was her way of saying thank you.
Great service here tonight but it's probably because our server Kevin is good. Most of the time it's hit or miss. Good time tonight.

Love coming here with my girlfriend on friday nights right before we hit the movies. Came im yesterday and Our server Ricky seemed really distracted and wasnt even paying attention to us when we were ordering. We ended up not making our movie and our order was messed up. Is this guy new??

My first review goes for this place the only reason I'm giving a second star is because the burger was good. I came in and had to sit my self . And as soon as I was approached by a employe instead of welcoming me , the first thing  I she said  was  "we close in 10 minute so please have your order ready" . That got me really mad  as they wanted me out before I even came in. Last time I come here  rather go waste my money somewhere else . No tip for Molly !!!

My family and I recently went to this red robin for my sisters birthday. I don't love this place but I had the best hamburger I have had in a long time! not only was the food amazing, but our service was incredible. Our server, Jamie was very friendly and came by our table often to see if we were doing okay and brought all of the things my needy family asked for. she was very cute too! I just wish more restaurants had service like this. Go check this red robin out because they are doing it right!!!

This is hands down my favorite family restaurant for many reasons.  You see mostly families here so I'm not the only one with a kid squirming around and talking way louder than he should.  I almost always get the Burnin' Love burger and it's always so freakin' good.  I have not had one disappointing meal here (hope I don't jinx it) and neither has my son.  Although, I have tried the Shroom burger and it's missing something.  Perhaps a garlic aioli and some onion straws?  It's literally just the patty, shrooms and cheese.  But I digress.  The servers are always very friendly and happy to accommodate us.  And the place just overall has a good vibe to it.  Everyone seems happy to be there and why shouldn't they be?  Lots of cool pics hanging on the wall to look at, friendly staff, great food, good drinks, and a kid friendly atmosphere.
Poor service. I luv red robin burgers but this place lacked service. 2 out of 3 orders were wrong, fries were cold and soggy .. Definitely didn't want 2nd's.

Sign up for the rewards !!!!!  Ask for more fries cz I guess u can get more and sweet potato fries too... The bathrooms were not up to date cz there was a lot of toilet paper on the ground but other than that had a great time with the family having a super late lunch

Went to have lunch with a couple friends I haven't seen in awhile. We ordered drinks and food. After getting are food and taking maybe 4 bites our check was on the table. Our drinks took longer to get. He was pushing us to leave after being there maybe 20/30 min. We wanted to order more drinks but didn't bother since we had our checks.  Not even done with our food Andrew said "are these ready?"(bill) we said no and asked for water and a Togo container since we were being rushed to leave and not able to enjoy our food. Our Togo containers came faster than our waters.  Very disappointed with the service.  The last thing you want when trying to enjoy a meal and time with friends is being rushed to leave.  He did the same with the table next to us. The restaurant was empty and it wasn't like people were waiting to be seated.
Service is terrible. They forget your order and take way too long making food. The waiters are very useless. Food is ok. Should hire more chefs and better waiters.

The food was fantastic as usual but the service was not good at all. Our friend got her milkshake way before we got our strawberry lemonade (which looked and tasted crappy). The guy was being really pushy for us to leave by giving us our bill a few minutes after we finally got our food. Maybe he was having an off day but i just really didnt think he was a good waiter. I would come back again but if i got him as a waiter i would move to another area lol
Excellent service as a manager of a restaurant I can tell good help jamie was on spot double sat and on a busy night food came out fast and w/smile she's a keeper 5 stars for jamie

My husband and I went back to Red Robin and this experience reminded why I love this place. We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip as an appetizer. It was delicious and we got extra chips as well. My husband got the bacon guacamole burger and it was everything he hoped for. He asked for some extra sauces for our fries so we got to try some different ones out. I got the A1 peppercorn burger, medium. It was slightly less cooked than I preferred, but it was still really good. The onion strings and bun are wonderful with it.  The server, Blain, was awesome. She was super friendly and quick and updated us with the status of everything. We went with an online gift card and a normal gift card and she was very accommodating.
So far staff has been great.  Also, happy hour all day?!?! Amazing!  I'm already loving this place.   Waitress Amber is amazing !

I'm a big fan of Red Robin having eaten at multiple locations nationwide . Shakes, burgers, and unlimited fries are their trademark. My kid likes their chicken and kids ice cream sundae. I really like the ava-cobb-o salad which I consistently get because it's one of the best salads anywhere in my opinion. My wife gets the spicy burger with ghost sauce and onion rings. I've had bites of everyone's and their each awesome to try. This location is nice located across from south coast plaza. Even so the wait times are reasonable and sometimes can get right in. Service is always proper and friendly.

What's happened to this restaurant, hopefully it's an isolated problem.  Restaurant is dirty and a grimy smell.  Ketchup, season salt shakers need to be cleaned...really cleaned not wiped down with a dirty wet rag.   Table at booth had a film on it from being wiped with s dirty towel.  Received our fires, cold.  Took them out of this tiny ring they served it with...and a pickle was at the bottom....nothing in my meal came with a pickle.  Kind of turned me off.  Super busy and staff wasn't prepared.  There were dirty dishes out up on the ledge that separated our booth from other patrons because the waiter never took them away and they needed the room.  However I didn't like having their dishes right at my nose.  Endless fries?  Well they only bring a small amount now and to ask for another takes forever.  Seems like maybe they've tried to become a bit more upscale with smaller portions, "gourmet " burgers.,, but you can't do that and not take care of your guests with a clean restaurant, frazzled staff and truly the quality of the food is not what it was.  Be the burger place you once were, don't try to be something you aren't and something you're unprepared to deliver on.  I won't go back to this one again...would question whether I'd go back to the chain in its entity.

Went for lunch with family.  Kids food came out fast, but waited 45 minutes for our food.  Had to ask for drink refills and for more fries.  When the tortilla soup came out, it looked like someone threw up in it. Waitress stayed in the room where they place their orders more than she did on the floor.  Four tables across from us sat empty and dirty the entire time. Will never go back there ever!!!

My favorite restaurant ever hands down! My friends always get annoyed because I always tell them I want to eat here when they ask me. It's not even funny how great this place is! First off the place itself is quite spacious with a lot of seating area and the walls are super cool with a bunch of posters!  Food: my favorite burgers are the bacon cheeseburger and red robin gourmet. I don't ever get anything super fancy. The fries here are the absolute best and the best part is that they are bottomless! The strawberry speckled is also a must have for me! They do this cool thing where you get a rewards Card and for every 10th item you get another item free. It's pretty convenient especially if you come here often! Customer service: the waitress' and hosts are always super nice especially Josh and Stephanie!  All in all if you're in the area and are looking for a good burger then you should come here and grab a bite!

Servers and hosts suck. They never listen, are passive aggressive, and clearly hate their jobs. (However, Dorri, the bartender, and Yves, the server, are great.... They probably hates their job too though.) Better management is probably the answer to all of these problems.  Also, WHY IS THERE ALWAYS A CRYING KID HERE?!  The only reason why I keep on coming back is because my dad and I have been coming here for 10+ years and he likes it. Food is almost always what you expect... Which is comforting.  Overall, food is good. Get it to-go.  Service: 2 stars  Dorri & Yves: 5 stars Food: 4 stars
I love this place! I tried their royal red robin hamburger and it was delicious.Good customer service, and every hour its happy hour.

Placed a large (13) carry out orders for our company luncheon. Clair aka Clair bear assisted me at 11am Tuesday morning she was extremely friendly and helpful. I sent a couple of co workers to pick up, she added extra fries (as you know Red Robin fries are the # ) and even added tonssss of ketchup, ranch and napkins. Food was great and the customer service was fantastic.  Thanks Clair!
The bartender here, Alex, is the most amazing bartender I've ever met. Super attentive no matter how busy he was, handled the bar like an absolute champion.

I love Red Robin. This location is under construction and smells horrible. I'd recommend that you wait a couple of weeks until you visit. There is dust everywhere and it smells like paint and drywall. My sinus went through the roof when I walked in the door.

Root beer floating away....... Our experience started off by ordering drinks. Danny (10 yrs) was so excited. He could get unlimited root beer float drink. After ordering all the drinks came but the root beer float. The server said it will be right up! Ok no problem.......what seemed like ages later we asked the server for it. Finally it came but kinda ruined the experience as his excitement for it was gone. All the rest of the food was ok. The fries were also bottomless but really we never ordered more anyway. It was expensive for what you got but maybe the Rootbeer experience just damper'd the rest of it.

I go to red robin all the time and I had my worst experience this last Thursday night. After being seated it must have taken 15 minutes for the server ""Ashley" to come to our table. We new what we wanted so we ordered right away. We did have 15 minutes before the server came over after all. She took our order and brought us our drinks. 15 minutes past and she brought another drink. Meanwhile everyone around us received their orders ate and left this is 45 minutes later and we committed that she did not even bring us napkins or silverware. She continued to stick her head out the little room she was in looking at us. I finally got up and went over to tell her we had to be somewhere and would like our food. She said something that the cooks had a big order before us. 2 other party's sat down after us and received their food and left. I let her know we did not have silverware she said she would get.  Meanwhile I went to the restroom that had the urinals over flowing urine on floor and paper towels all over the floor. Another patron was complaining to me about the restroom mess. I sat down 60 minutes has past and our food arrived. I reminded the server we did not have any silverware! Ashley said she would be right back. The food stayed in front of my wife and granddaughter. 5 minutes went by and I went to get silverware that's when Ashley came by and she said she would get it. The manager I think his name was John came to the table and apologized and offered free desserts. We declined but said to him we appreciate him coming over and offering. I have been going for years and never had this bad of service. Gave 2 stars for the food quality, it all begins with the servers attitude. Maybe Ashley needs more training or supervision!

There was a few things that went wrong.  So let's start my husband goes and put his name on the list he was told 20 mins. Great it was Saturday evening beginning of dinner rush. We wait our 20 mins but see several parties go ahead of us that came after us. So I go up to the front they said our table was given away because they called us. Umm we sat right in the front there was no way they called us. They tell me you will be at the front of the list. We finally get seated. Our server gets us menus I immediately order for my two year old pass 25 minutes and no food. Then she comes back finally to take our order we order, I ask and finally she brings my child's food. We get our food with a side of nasty ass attitude. When I ask for a round of bottomless fries she brings one plate of cold fries about 10 mins after I ask. Finally I get the managers attention and ask for the fries and new server. And surprise 2 minute later our fries were there. This is the second time I've gone to a different Red Robin and had the worse service.

I usually love Red Robin but today they were a mess. Our food was cold, the BLT wasn't any good, and the French Onion soup was nothing better than a can of store bought with melted cheese over it. The manager was nice and have a discount for the cold food. Overall it was a lame dinner.

One of my favorite restaurants for burgers. Unfortunately, the customer service is very hit and miss which is the reason I don't go very often. Sometimes the server cannot be found and I will spend 10 minutes waiting for utensils, napkins, or sauce. Some servers are good and some are bad. I wish management would make a better effort to train them better. If the service was good all the time, I would definitely go more often.

Unfortunately they decided to try and change their style and food .. Neither worked.  Not too sure how you can mess up salads, but they successfully did.  Looks like it's time to toss their royalty card- won't be using that anymore.

We frequently dine at Red Robin in Foothill Ranch, and the service is always great. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said about this location. We sat at a table for 20 minutes before having to ask the hostess for a server. After ordering our food, we waited over 40 minutes for it, were given dirty silverware, and were not checked on one time. We will definitely NOT be back to this location.

I'm not sure why Red Robin decided I can't have romaine for my salads anymore. I used to love this franchise but their menu changes didn't leave me with my favorites intact. Not everyone is super keen on mixed greens :( I don't feel like going back until they offer more than one salad choice. Honestly now.

I cant believe these guys don't have a 5 star rating across the board. Everything is always great and its priced right with excellent service. Try the burgers lettuce wrapped and you'll be back any time you crave a good burger.

I've received bad service today at Red Robin when I came with my family, food took 25+ min to receive the server Lindsay was not on her A game she didn't offer any additional services had to keep insisting her to bring me condiments for my burger and Fries and yet took her sweet time to receive these items. She didn't offer any additional assistance yet she took my sons plates with food with out even asking if it was ok since they we're still eating. Had to keep flagging her down since she wouldn't pay attention to our table. Yet I got up to look for the manager to the front desk no one was around and myself watch 5 people walk away and say poor service because they couldn't get seated because there was no host in the front.  I waked towards a guy who looked like the manager and asked if he was he said yes. Name was Ein something like that lol but sure enough I explain my situation and all he said "I'm sorry to hear that wish I could've got to you sooner" didn't do much walked back to my table and paid for my meal and walked away nerve again going to this Red Robin again!!! Manager had the chance to make it right and never did. I wouldn't recommend this place to my friends.

The new lighting over the table is too harsh, headache harsh. The manager was unable to dim the light. We usually dine at Spectrum it's overall nicer. One of the managers was on the floor the whole time but not engaging the guests, he was staring at the I pad they use to track empty tables. My opinion, host work. Eyes on the prize.
Good food, great onion rings, and cool electronic ordering system! You order straight from a device!

WHAT HAPPENED!! So disappointed with what Red Robin has done to its menu. I went for lunch today and I have not been disappointed by them before so I didn't anticipate any issues. I ordered my usual Avo-Cobb-o salad which is my go to fav every visit. What I got was not the amazing salad I normally get but a handful of wilted lettuce. Why are there cucumbers in this salad and where are the eggs?? I was so wholeheartedly disappointed. Not to mention that the salad was a 1/3 the size of the one i used to get for the same price. I felt so cheated. Not sure what sparked the drastic change but don't think I will be coming back.
Burgers are a slam dunk! The male servers are good. The hostesses need some work on customer service. My daughter loved the meatballs on the kids menu.

The changes made at RR are horrible. When the burgers are grossly overpriced then excellent service is expected.  Instead what we got was to be seated at a table w/o napkins or utensils.  Had to ask for napkins after our food came and had wait for 1 napkin per person was brought while our food got cold.  Ordered an iced tea and was asked how many sweeteners I needed and was brought exactly that (1 packet of Splenda). The fries were stale on both of our plates.  We were not told that the device on our table was actually our server.  Apparently you order drink refills, request a server, and pay the bill from there.  EXCEPT ours didn't work and our "server" knew this.  Did that cause her to actually give us service.  Nope!  Instead she was chit chatting in the back despite having only 2 tables.  She came by once and saw our drinks were empty and asked if we needed anything but walked away before we could respond.  We had to stand up and stare at her before she bothered to come back and process our bill even though she knew the device wasn't working.  I USED to be a loyal customer.  Never going back again.  This company is clearly GREEDY having the audacity to charge $14 for a burger yet giving 1 packet of Splenda and 1 napkin per customer and serving stale fries.
One of the best customer service and great quality food love their bottomless fries :)

A friend invited me last Tuesday for Free Tavern Double Tuesday. Every Tuesday apparently it's a Go for that deal. I'm not much of a Red Meat Eater so  I personally got the Croissant BLTA Sandwich. It was A-Ok. Nothing too fancy. The picture made it look way to good. Also, something that threw me off the wall was the photo they have in the waiting area. There's a spacecraft shining it's light down on a cow. That was pretty freaky to me, especially since I've seen some documentaries of this sort. Will I be back? Probably, but only becuase the service was good and my family loves Red Robin. My server was Kate and she was attentive. Happy Eating!

Sorry Red Robin on Sunflower but you are going downhill.  New menu, new look but unfortunately in two visits you've not impressed.  Servers are stretched thin.  Soda is flat.  Food is not prepared as stated in menu and then when questioned, "oh, sorry, that's not part of that item anymore.  The menu just isn't updated."  Funny because it's a new menu...  On the positive, deals on appetizers, you can watch sports and bottomless fries.

Red Robin on Sunflower has been a family standard for us for many years.  It has new decorations inside now (kinda OK) and it has a new fancy payment system that allows the diner to pay for their food by swiping their card at the table.  In the last few years they moved away from serving their burgers in a plastic basket with fries to a plate with a wierd metal tube holding 1/3 the fries they used to serve.  So you now get to ask for french fry refills 3 times while worrying about your credit data flying through the RF network at the restaraunt.  Other than that, its still good food when you have a craving for Red Robin.

We got a table after 10 mins. Awesome well then it went down hill fast. When are food came the fries were cold, I told the server and she she never came back, I mean never. To add to that my husbands burger was soggy and cold. We ate what we could and after 10 mins of waiting after they bussed our plates and still no server we had to flag down for a manager to get out check. While waiting that 5 minutes, my 10 month old daughter spilled my water all over the table and myself. I asked another server who saw her do it for a towel and he stood their watching TV for 2 mins before he did anything.  They don't even deserve the one star. As a new family we look for family restarants and this place just sucks.

It's sad to say what was once a wonderful place to work and eat has completely fallen apart! I was an employee for 8 years and for many years I was proud to say I worked there. I would recommend the food to everyone I knew. I believed In red robin and what they stood for. I felt they truly cared about their employees and encouraged advancement in the company. I felt the staff in return cared about the guests and took pride in the quality of food they served. They made regulars and looked forward to work most days, because it had a family feel. Unfortunately I would say in the last few years everything has changed. It started slow... But it did not take long before they were a completely different restaurant and not for the better. The new changes impacted the guests and employees. Regulars stopped coming, the morale of the staff sank, and eventually most of the tenured staff had left. What happened to valuing your staff? What happened to great food? What happened to a happy atmosphere that everyone could enjoy? I think all they have left is their delicious ranch.  Red Robin... Please bring back the great people that used to run your company. There are enough of the money hungry corporate restaurants with robots as servers and microwaved food.
Great Service and great food. What a combination. This is my favorite lunch spot. Always great service and exceptional quality of food. I would recommend this place to all friends and family.

Wednesday night 8p in the bar area horrible service Josh' has no service skills or customer service techniques. Forgot order when placing it, sprite with only soda water, forgot order when place it , food with blue cheese nuggets had to scrape off he didn't even offer to replace? No follow up no asking  we asked him -water-refills*... Go do something else work in a factory or something you don't have to be around people because you have no service skills at all.

So check out, the food here is really good. Great chicken dishes, awesome burgers and really good appetizers. Buffalo Wild Wings opened up around the corner. There food is good but not ass good as it is here. We like to watch football and thus place only has 3 TV's. I looked around and the bar is wired for at least 3 more and technically there is room for another 5 or 6. Here is where it really gets good. The Buffalo Wild Wings around the corner has a two hour wait right now because of Thursday Night Football. The bar is packed, the restaurant is packed and this place is empty.  Maybe they need to get a few more TV's and hang a banner out front. Maybe do a mailer and take advantage of this think called NFL.  Come on upper management wake up, it's the 90's

Make sure to check your food before taking a bite. I found a lady bug in my spinach dip. Told the manager all he said is "Sorry, we get this from outside vendors and are prepackaged. We throw it in the microwave and serve it." I believe they should check every item that comes out of their kitchen to make sure their customer qet a quality meal. The spinach dip we got came with onions, but when we selected the dip on the tablet we asked without onions. We told the server didn't change it out and said we could but it too the side. Very unprofessional!  Also our burgers came out messed up. We also asked for more bottomless fries never got them.

Terrible service! We waited an hour and had to ask to get a server to take our orders. She only came once after taking our orders to check up on us. And to top it all off... The meats were not the right temperature and there was hair in one of my daughters burgers! I will not be recommending this place, management is awful.

The new renovation is awful . My Family and I were very disappointed on are last visit. Long wait and their were table open to start . So where do I start , First watched someone get in to there car that looked as if he had too much to drink and I let the manager know and just blew it off.  The Service was very slow and the New Art Gallery sport bar theme had a spot light pointed right over me it was very distracting . When the food came the Fires tasted awful and my wife burger was over cooked to the point that she could not eat it Sad they were always so good. Then to top it off their lame table checkout is messed up and delayed us from leaving. We were unable to take our nice shopping as things took so long . We will not be back and after years of going their over 12 years  we no longer think it is a good place for kids too.

We have been coming to this location for close to 15 years for at least twice a month. Since their remodel and staffing changes this place is definitely not worth it. I ordered items to pick up and when I arrived the manager - Aiden - was completely rude and pawned me off to a newbie who told me that one of the items I ordered was no longer on the menu. Rather than let me know at the time I placed the order that they no longer offered this, he waited to tell me when I showed up. Well, after I explained that they did in fact have a similar salad they went off to prepare it while the rest of my food sat there getting cold. In the meantime I asked the manager how they could take my order and not let me know on the phone it wasn't offered? He looked at me and walked away from me without an answer and managed to completely avoid eye contact the whole time I waited (at least 20 minutes). Then when I get home with the food the fries were cold. There were maybe 12 fries in the order...and the chicken was rubbery. I threw most of it away. It's so sad to see a tried and true family place deteriorate this way. My royalty card? Just cut it up and won't be back.
This was a nice, remodeled Red Robin. The service was great, the margaritas and maitais were stiff and my free birthday burger was delicious. No complaints!

Craving for a delicious hamburger? This is the place to go. So many varieties to chose from you wish u had a couple of friend to share with so u can try them all. Best of all is the little device at the edge of the table that can take ur order, pay ur bills, and print ur receipt so u don't have to wait for ur server.

Our friend from North Carolina was visiting Los Angeles on a business trip. He was staying by John Wayne so we decided to meet up for lunch and also catch a football game.  Pros: Typical with any Red Robin, the burger selection was good and the burger itself was actually good. Cons: TV's were inconveniently placed in the Sunroom looking dining area.  Long Island's were missing alcohol, I think (-1) Our neighboring table had crayons and kid's menu but we did not have it until an Hour into our meal. We requested our waitress couple of times for this, but she forgot about it, I think. (-1) Our experiences with Red Robin were good at other locations but not so good at this restaurant. So, we will not be returning to this place if we were in the area. Sorry.

Horrible, horrible, horrible. Worst experience we've ever had at a restaurant. Fortunately the managers made things right but this couldn't have been any worse. Find another Red Robin if you're  really craving it. It's the best advice I can give you.

I grew up going to Red Robin, my family and I would go back again and again. I have no idea why, must have been the wide variety on the menu and the reasonable prices.  Now in my adult life I find myself going, not every week but every once in awhile. They have good fries and when I have a chicken finger craving it's my number one thought.  The food is decent and the service is awful, which is something I have known since I was young and remind myself of each time I choose to go to this restaurant. I typically don't complain but after this experience I feel as though I should share.  I am recently gluten and dairy free so I asked for their special menu, I learned they had online. The host didn't know what I was talking about but said that he would find out for me, which I appreciated. We were sat at the table and the waiter came over. After ordering drinks we asked for my menu and he came back showing me how to order. I was excited to learn that the selection wasn't too limited. We ordered an appetizer and got our drinks. We sat for about an hour before hearing anything about our food which was finally delivered shortly past the hour after we ordered it. I was immediately disappointed to see that I had been given a burger instead of the chicken sandwich that I had ordered. I sent it back and he said it would be fixed. My brother also ordered a kids macaroni and cheese, with extra macaroni and cheese oppose to a side which is something we had ordered for him many times and it hadn't been an issue. The waiter didn't tell us they couldn't do it until they brought his food, so we also had to ask for another order of it. I waited for my chicken sandwich and they brought it to me, this time with red onions opposed to the grilled ones I asked for, I didn't say anything though because I didn't want to wait for it. After all finishing our food we were still waiting for the other kids macaroni and cheese.  Overall we had terrible service, as we didn't get our drinks refilled and our waiter seemed unsympathetic to the fact that two out of four orders were wrong (one of them wrong twice). The food was mediocre as my brothers first order of macaroni and cheese was burnt.  Probably done going back to Red Robin. I would rather pay more to save the time and headache.

I usually don't review chain places but I really feel the need to mention an employee here. My boyfriend and I came here for dinner, something we do very often. Waited about 10 minutes for a table and were seated on one half of the restaurant that was completely empty except for the 3 tables in line with us that had larger parties. It took about 10-15 minutes for a waited to even come to our table to take our drink order, which by that time we already knew what entrees we wanted. Our server, Matthew, came over finally and apologized for the wait time after we asked if it was really busy. He put our order in right away and close to used to check in with us the rest of the night - he brought our food out later and we could tell it was brought as soon as it was done because it was still really hot. I think the manager might have stopped by our table - but it was really just a lady came by and said "how are you guys doing. Good? Good." And then left. That was weird. But I really appreciate the attention that Matthew paid to our table after seeing our dissatisfaction, rather than shoving free stuff in our face to try and make up. He upped his customer service game and fixed the issue that we were upset with, which is what should be done. Will be returning for sure!

I now come here on a regular basis with a special needs individual who loves this place more than ever. I was more than pleasantly surprised at the service we receive, even though he is quite disruptive and makes a large mess. Many of the staff know him and make special efforts to ensure his experience is as best as it can be, such as remembering his favorite booth and order. Several employees make time to come greet and say hello to him. I'm truly grateful and amazed at the service and compassion showed by the excellent servers, especially when we are not exactly the easiest guests!

I really enjoyed my experience here dining in with my boyfriend tonight.  This location looks really nice and happens to be conveniently located right next to many other popular shops in the south coast metro area. We sat at the bar and ordered fish and chips and their famous strawberry lemonade. Our waiter's name was Alex, and we were extremely impressed with how great his customer service was. He was very polite and tentative, basically reading our minds to refill our fries and drinks without having to say a word.  Alex definitely made our time here tonight an enjoyable one, and we plan to come back here sometime again soon!

Terrible take out service and horrible customer service by Claire. This review is long over due. Well I placed an order from my work for take out, the person on the phone said it would be about 20 mins till the order was ready to pick up. So I waited at work for about 15 mins then clocked out & drove across the street for my lunch, by this time about 20 mins had gone by since I called in the order. I get to the restaurant and paid for my food then waited.... And waited .... And waited... 5 mins.... 10 mins.... 20mins!!!! I finally had to cancel my order because I had no time left on my 30 min lunch break. Clair was very rude to me about this. I told her I had no time left and if she would have told me on the phone that it would be almost an hour before my food was ready I would have just not bothered to order or I could have killed more time at work. She snapped at me and talked back making me feel as if i had said or did something wrong. She never once offered to make the situation better or never even brought out a manager. She then gave me my refund receipt and wrote "john" the managers name on it and told me to talk to him about it. I walked out very upset. You can bet I told everyone at my office about this situation.

Red robin is always a hit or miss. You either have good service or bad service. The last time I came here for dinner (Thursday night), we had a great server. She forgot to bring us napkins and water, but her attitude was great!  We ordered a bbq burger and the royal red robin. The bbq burger was lacking ingredients; it seemed pretty small compared to the Royal. The Royal Red Robin (bacon lettuce tomatoes add an egg) was colorful and tasteful! The side of romaine lettuce salad was very sad though. The lettuce was very flimsy and old. No crunch to it at all!  The seats were a bit dirty all around us. The bussers don't seem to care about the crumbs all over the seats and floors.  Make sure to check the bar area for open seating before having to wait for a table. But you must be 21 to be up there.

I use to really like the Banzai burger here but it wasn't cutting in when I recently went. We ordered the Towering Onion Rings and Northern Poutine and those items were really good but very filling. Service was okay, and you have the option of ordering things on their tablet on your table. This place has remodeled since the last time I went here which was years ago so expect a modern feel.

Thin slimy uncooked bacon with withered lettuce, makes all the rest of the food unpleasant.  Use to be good about 7 years ago.  Steady going down hill.  Your better off saving few dollars going fast food cause its not much better.  Or spend extra $1 and go to a real burger restaurant.

I have frequented this Red Robins on numerous occasions because it's walking distance from my house. Usually, it's a great experience and I sit at the bar and avoid waiting....The "Insane Romain" has been good in the past, but today it was not. The lettuce was out of control-an unmanageable disaster and burnt/wilted on 1/3....no crutons and chicken not up to par. Beer is good...waitresses cute.....

The burgers and fries are good. I also like the new look.  The bar seems to be really cold sometimes and the bathrooms are always gross! So gross so therefore 3 stars. Maybe 2 1/2.  Please clean your restrooms. The service, as someone had said before, is a hit or miss.
Not happy. We like the Red Robin in Irvine better.
Order to go: the burger was fine..looks like it was put together in hurry.  sloppy looking.  order onion ring as well.  they were burn.  pretty much trash all of it

If you stick with the burgers and bottled spirits you'll be fine! Ordered two patron margaritas and a Long Island iced tea. Worst margarita ever!!! Sour and ugh! Same with the iced tea... Who's ever made one that's sour?!??? Hope the bartender was a Sub! Also ordered the Mac and cheese ...  Macaroni with a slight sauce and melted cheese does not meet the mark. The 4 of us that had burgers had no food complaints.
Consistent. Good food. It's a chain. Ensenada chicken platter, BBQ chicken sandwich, and chicken tortilla soup are my go to things. Strawberry lemonade is fantastic. Hot wings to start!

Red Robin. I'm a member of your loyalty program. My kids really believe that there is one in every city that we go to, whether it's in the Bay Area or in Southern California. Our last family trip to Disneyland was no different. We're staying in a Doubletree Hotel (where my brother works at back here at home), there must be a Red Robin around too. I'm not sure if that's their full thought process on RR's, but I would bet money on my theory.  Anyways, we sought out a RR about two miles away from our hotel. It was January 1st about 3:00PM when we arrived. We had lasted in Disneyland until 2AM the night before, so we were lagging, tired and ready for some food. We were seated right away, as there weren't many people in there at the time. There were a few other tables that had customers at them. I believe there was only one waiter at the time. He came over within a few minutes of us being seated and took our drink order.  I tried handing him my rewards card, as most of the RR's ask for it right away. He said that he would take it when the check comes. We pretty much order the same thing when we come every time. Double order of cheese sticks for appetizers, two clucks and fries, kids mac and cheese with mandarin oranges, teriyaki chicken burger, no lettuce and five alarm burger with no tomatoes. He came back with our drinks, helped the other table with something they needed and then took our order. He ordered the appetizers on the kiosk screen at our table when we told him we wanted them. I'm not sure if the order gets in that much faster, but that was the first time that I've ever had a waiter put the appetizer order in at the screen instead of just placing it himself. I could understand if it was super busy and the order would get in faster, but there really was not a lot of people. Anyways, I'm assuming a manager, brought out the cheese sticks. But there wasn't any ranch with it, just marinara. My kids noticed right away that the ranch was missing and we asked for some. A weird thing to have missing, especially when a higher up is delivering them to a table. We received our food within a timely manner and everything tasted good and was correct. There's just some things that I notice or expect, I suppose when dining at a Red Robin. Drinks were not refilled without being empty and asked multiple times. We showed a coupon we had for a birthday burger. There was no singing for my twins...luckily they didn't care that there was no singing or birthday sundae. Just some things that I noticed about this visit that were overlooked or odd that it didn't happen. But it's nothing traumatic or to make me upset, just observations. I know that we'll be back at Red Robin again soon.

Service was great! Eat in the bar area since it is faster and self seating. Our waiter Andrew was great. Ordered the royal red robin and the pepper jack hamburger. Came out in a timely manner. Highly recommend the onion tower!! No complaints.

My boyfriend and I come eat at Red Robin a lot! We have had the server, Matthew, a few times and he is the best! So funny, helpful, attentive, and just everything ood in a server. All of the servers we have there are honestly all great also, Ive never had a bad experience with any. The food is always delicious and perfect everytime! Once our appetizer came out a little late, which was no biggie, and the manager came to us directly without us expecting or asking and he apologized and gave it to us for free! Which we totally did not expect, it was so nice I wish I remembered his name. Everything about Red Robin is just great!

Well, this is the nearest location to my home...so I always come here... Usually service is pretty good. But wow this one really sucked!!!! We were seated fairly quickly(that's a plus) but it all went down hill from there!!! :( first of all, no one comes to help us out for some time. Like really!!! Ugh!!! Ok finally someone attends us and we order 2 freckle lemonades... Yum delicious but wait! THERES A BLACK HAIR IN MY DRINK!!! Ahhhh!!!not mine, I have red hair, and Bf is bald -_- I tell the waiter and he simply takes my cup and comes back and says "hairless lemonade for you".. Ughm not funny... Second of all, I order a bacon cheeseburger with no tomato and here they come with some blue burger.. What the!!!?!? That wasn't my order. So I had to sit and wait for them to make me my order right and just stared at my boyfriend eat :( by then I was just super upset..finally my burger comes out but guess what!? Yup! It has tomato :-'( Ahhh!!! What the flip man!!! Waiter says "ah shoot they put tomato do u want to just take it off yourself" really??? Wahhhh!!! I just wanna cry at that point.. So I just pulled it off my burger and ate it like that. The burger was super dry as well... By far the worst experience .. Felt super unappreciated.. I will from now on try the location on Harbor and chapman. Sorry guys. You lost a valuable costumer .. And I am there very very often.. By the way he forgot my campfire sauce too!!! Boooooo!!!!! On top of it I have to leave a dam tip.! He did not deserve it but whatever. We gotta tip.

We come to Red Robin on a regular basis and their food is always amazing.  Great burgers, awesome appetizers and decent prices. They have a huge variety of food.  I always get bacon cheeseburger and its delicious.The strawberry lemonade is good and you can't go wrong with bottomless fresh fries.  We always get such great service at any location we visit.

This is my favorite of all the Red Robin locations. The restaurants in Brea, Garden Grove, La Habra, and Whittier all pale in comparison to the South Coast Plaza Red Robin. Reason being is the service and the amount of toppings placed on the burger. It seems like whenever I'm at this location, they give me extra mushrooms or bacon without me asking. It's never expected and it's always a pleasant surprise.  On my last visit I tried their newest burger. The Southern Charm burger is topped with candied bacon, honey BBQ sauce, sharp Cheddar and caramelized onions on a toasted ciabatta bun. As per the waitress's suggestion, it paired well with a Not your Fathers Root Beer.  I don't always eat burgers, but I'm always satisfied with Red Robin, South Coast. =)
The Angus Black and Blue burger is my current favorite ordered medium rare. Skrum-dilly-ouptions...I usually substitute the fries for onion rings that are divine.

Will not be back.  Stopped in for a quick meal after some Christmas shopping and it was terrible experience.  The server was rude and dismissive when we were undecided on our drink order and then when I had questions, she spoke down to us.  The worst part was the $90+ tab which was a result of us ordering a pint of cider with a shot.  This drink is $8 in most places and we were charged almost double that without being told.  Bad food and bad service.

So this review isn't about the food or the cleanliness or even the quality of the restaurant itself (although we love this place), this is a review about the 2 people whom are employed here! We stopped here for a late dinner with a close friend that we don't get to see that often for the root beer floats and burgers. It started out like any ordinary evening with the waitress being alittle busy but being attentive and bringing exactly what we ordered. The root beer floats were amazing as always and the burgers were just phenomenal this evening. We finished our meals, paid and got ready to say goodbye to our friend when my daughter asked for a balloon and unfortunately they didn't have blown up so the host, James, told us to hang out and he would go grab some and it would take just a moment. So my wife asked me if I could go grab the car and pull it up, (kinda a cool night) so of course I oblige and walk out the door on a direct path for the car but was greeted very kindly by an older homeless gentleman asking for a dollar or two so he could get something hot to eat. Unfortunately I don't carry cash but I did happen to have some dollars in the car and told him I would see what I had and I'd be right back. As I was walking to the car something struck me (I am a very observative person) although he didn't gloat it or even mention it trying to get money, I noticed he was a USMC veteran by a ring and his tattoo on his forearm. So as I drove back up I found a $20 bill. With my wife and daughter waiting for me I parked and told them to wait in the car until I got back. I walked up to the gentleman and asked him if he had served and what branch, he introduced himself as Tedd and confirmed he was a disabled USMC veteran that had served our country in Vietnam. He had fallen on hard times and with no family around he was forced into homelessness and is working on finding work so he can hopefully get a place soon. So I ask him if instead of giving him a couple of dollars if I could buy him a hot meal. He lit up like a kid on Christmas morning and excitedly thanked me at least 4 times. I asked him if he would like to come in and order and he said he felt uncomfortable since he hadn't had a shower in days so I took his order and went in. The same host asked me if everything was okay (probably since I was just there and then came back in) and if there was anything I needed. I told him I would like to get the homeless veteran a meal and gave him the order. He said he would be right back with the ticket and he would make sure the gentleman got his meal and drink. So as I was waiting the manager, Tai, walks up and asks me if I had any questions or needed anything. I said "as a matter of fact I do have a question, there is an older homeless veteran outside and I am going to buy him a hot meal. Is there a way that he can enjoy his meal inside at a table? Ill pay the tip in advance." He said with a shocked look "Absolutely, I had no idea anyone was out there!" After a few more words with Tai, James came back up with a bill and so I handed him the $20 and as he turns to go get my change, the manager stops him and says "here let me take care of this" at this point I'm thinking, okay cool he is gonna discount it for me but instead he hands me back my $20 and says "this ones on us" shocked I said " its okay I am happy to pay for it" and he argues saying "no really we want to, please go ask him to come in and we will get a table ready." I walked outside handed the guy the money that the manager told me to keep and told him the meal was paid for and to just keep his focus and he will be back on the right path soon. He thanked me with many thanks and tears in his eyes and with that I told him to enjoy his meal and sorry i had to run but if I see him again we will sit down for a meal together. He thanked me again, shook my hand and off I went.  I was truly overwhelmed with happiness with this managers gesture! If you are in the area of this Red Robin stop in and say hi to James (host) and Tai (the manager) and show them gratitude for the great people that they are! Thank you Tai and James for everything you did last night for me and Tedd, and keep up the EXCELLENT service! We will return soon!

This is the first location I ever went to. As always great food and atmosphere. I was part of a party and used the new Kyosk system to pay my bill. Totally awesome. Easy to use and divide the bill. I got the Patty Melt this trip. Excellent.

Took a bit for server to come take our drink orders, when she did she had an attitude, food was sitting,waiting for someone to deliver,  vanessa was our server, she was terrible we had to ask her for everything even silverware and napkins it took her a long time to get refills on the the ice tea, hot water. The restaurant had look like it was all closed up the chairs were all put up on tables and this is before 9 o'clock the restaurant closes at 10, food was good
Used to be good not anymore the server forgot our appetizers and drinks wasn't a good experience good wasn't all that good either.. I would rather go get a fast food burger....

I love the burgers but my word their pick-up call in process is absurd.  I've done it at least four times and all I order is two burgers and it takes 5 minutes to get thru on the phone then 20 min to place the order which is normal then I wait another 20 at the restaurant for the food.  45 minutes.  Clean it up guys.

They used to be good, but not so much anymore. The food is sub par but the problem is that the restaurant itself is fairly large and they never have even close the amount of wait staff needed. I'm not sure if the manager is trying to save money but it the long run they are going to lose. We waited a little over 15 minutes yesterday and there was plenty of space but as we have always noticed when we go here (the in-laws like the location aspect) they never have enough people working and it is so irritating. I also HATE the touch pad check out, it takes up too much room on the table and it's constantly flashing, just annoying.  Stop trying to be so cheap and hire some people.

We were in South Coast Plaza with our kids at dinner time at about 6pm. We ended up going to this location for dinner.  Living in Costa Mesa for 30 plus years this use to be a busy and good place to go.  Being 6ish the place was empty and having our meal we understood why!  My wife had the BLTA sandwich which she could not eat.  It was basically tasteless and a poor choose.   I had one of the featured burgers which was just average.  So the food was NOT worth the cost.  Being slow and empty inside our server hardly ever visited the table,so again I rate it poor.  Sorry to say we will not return, and it's the second poor visit from Red Robin, we are going to probably remove them from our list of restaurants to visit or take clients

Extremely slow service. Came in at 6:05 on a Thursday. We were sat quickly (2 of us) but then not greeted for 10 minutes. Immediately ordered an appetizer that didn't come for 30 minutes, food didn't come for almost an hour. I worked in red robin so I know how it is but this was a case of understaffed servers and poor management. They quadruple sat my servers section slowing the pace for my service and large tables around me. I couldn't even get a refill, or her attention to pay my bill. The digital modules at the table are a joke. Never coming back.

I used to love this place. They had the best garlic parm fries and beef dip. The beef dip is no longer in the menu. The garlic parm fries aren't as good as they used to be. These were the things I craved from red robin. Oh well.

Came back to this location because we were craving burgers and fries on Friday and I am so glad I gave them another chance.  Big shout out to Jordan (our server) - she was fantastic, on top of everything we needed before we even asked, and just down to earth and fun and made us feel like family.  After we were seated we got notice that another friend was joining us so she helped move us to an already closed section, which was really kind.  Also the host, I think his name was Kohl, he was a tall buff guy, was awesome as well, made is feel right at home and even judged a coloring competition for us.  The food was above average, and Jordan kept the fries coming.  We had a great time and walked out more than satisfied with our food.  After this, we will be back again for a good cheap burger and fry!

Okay this place is alright.  The staff are always busy and you need to flag them down.  Ive have issuse with them before because they have messed up a couple of my orders in the past but nothing an email wont fix (yes i will email the company when i am not satisfied with the product) Over all its close to my house and when i want a burger fix we come here.  Wish there staff would be friendly but whatever im just here to eat right and not make a life time friend with my waitress lol

If you go there check your receipt.  I was overcharged by 10.00, when I noticed after reconciling my bank account I was told oh this happens.  In the end I did get my $10.00 refunded, no apology, no nothing.  Just compare your receipt with what you wrote on the original.  Not sure who was the crook the waiter or the establishment.

Haven't eaten here for sometime, was not impressed. The food was typical not great not bad, however noticed a foul odor entire time. Perhaps it was luck of the draw and they had some recent plumbing work done but it really started to bother me after 20 minutes. i'm rating them two stars because the staff was fine and the food was OK. However I won't be returning anytime soon.

This shall be the last time!...I thought I proclaimed that the last time but we went for my sister-in-law's birthday dinner this time. Our booth had dirt, as in mud, on the seats. They said they were going to bring someone to clean it with a towel but that never happened. I had to use a lot of napkins to clean it off. We asked for a booster seat and it was super sticky and just smelled bad. At least wipe it down once in a while guys!  Our waitress was sort of nice but she made a lot of mistakes and misses. In our section, which is her section, there was only two other tables besides us. We ordered our food. I ordered a salad (Southwest sombrero) which I've never tried previously. Didn't want to get a burger because I'm over their burgers from the last time.  While waiting for our food, I noticed a foul odor that reminded me of a dirty toilet. It's not a smell you want while you eat. They started making coffee which masked most of the smell. Thank goodness! Lol. Our server was slow and kept forgetting to bring us things we asked for or things that come standard with the stuff we ordered. At the end, we noticed she had forgotten 5 things that night. Sides were missing, wrong sides were brought... Milkshakes were the wrong size and they had to make new ones because she had forgotten to bring us our shakes so it was just sitting on the counter and they threw it away not knowing which table it was. What a waste. The banana milkshake which used to be good here, now tastes like banana flavored powder instead of real bananas.  My salad was so bland in flavor but just tasted like salt, and the chicken tasted burnt. The 'sombrero' which was a tostada with cheese on it was stale, greasy, and the cheese looked like it had been microwaved on a couple times (you know what I'm talking about?) Everyone said their burger was meh. We did like the fried pickles though, so 1 star for that.  The steak fries weren't as good tonight too, which is sad because they were the only things I liked about RR with the ranch and honey mustard poppyseed sauce. Anyways, I can safely say that I won't miss RR if I never ate it again. I would say 1.5 stars but rounding up to 2 for my sis in law's bday.
Jordan was the homie. Service was quick. Cracked good jokes. Also hooked it up with ice cream. Bless.

Ordered take out at 7:55pm and I was estimated a 20-25 minute wait time. I'm still here waiting on my order and it is 8:45pm. It's safe to say I will not be ordering from here again. What a waste of time. If I wanted a long wait, I would have dined in. I'll update my review when I taste my (presumably cold) food.  -_____-

Visited last week for dinner after a long day of work. we sat in the bar, which we probably shouldn't have. We usually visit the Cypress location but this was close to where we were working at we decided to go here. The food. My son's meal of chicken and fries, were cold upon arrival. He mentioned this twice to the waitress, she said "What would you like me to do, reheat it?" He said no, could you bring me out some hot ones. She brought him 1 piece of chicken on a plate, sat it down on the table and walked away. He also asked for fries since those were cold also. She brought it 5 fries. My veggie burger had seen better days also. It looked like someone smashed it, their was hardly any toppings on it, the bun was smooched and I also only got 5 fries, Thank God for bottomless fries! But the bottom line is, if I am paying almost $30 for a meal/dinner. I want it hot, fresh and a good amount on my plate! Having to ask over and over for more fries since all she brought out was 5 at a time was ridiculous, She also took my ice tea to refill it and didn't bring it back for 15 minutes. Why wasn't a picture brought out? I wont be visiting this location any more, I'll stick with Cypress where I know I'm paying for a good, filling meal. But really, cold chicken and asked if I wanted it re heated? Not good customer service!

The atmosphere and drink options are good, easy to find something appealing for both him and of course fruity for her.  They also have a "skinny" low calorie drink section. The food is decent but we typically end up going for a healthier option lately and lets be honest here, its never as good as the rest.  I like their reward program where you get a free birthday burger the month of your birthday so it makes for a good cheap date (usually under $40) dinner out.  They have a new computerized "self service" tablet deal on all the tables.  I do like that you can pay your be and leave the moment your done, but I felt a little weird needing to hit the "call waitress" button on it,  I never actually did, I resorted to the old fashion way of politely asking when she passed by.  Another benefit of the system is that you can split the bill yourselves as needed so in theory that sounds cool but awkward in a group setting I presume.  BTW you are probably best opting for the email receipt as the printer did not work on ours.  Welcome to the future.

Came with family today. We got sat pretty fast but it did take a while for our server to get to our work table at least 5 to 7 minutes. We were little confused and wondered if we called our server through the electronic device left at the table but we patiently waited. Once a server got to our table we ordered drinks but we were ready to order our food also since we had been waiting long enough.  I think the price was definitely fair and the food was really good so I was really happy in that area. I got the pepper burger that they were advertising and sweet potato fries to complement it. I'm giving this place 4 stars since it was a good restaurant good food but I can't give it five stars. Just felt like another burger joint. This place gets 4 stars from me.

Let me start this review by stating that I LOVE RED ROBIN! So much so that I worked at two when I was I was in school. My training there made me a fabulous bartender and cocktail server that supported me for many years in school. And I owed it to the care, training, skills, courtesy and expectations I learned from Red Robin.  But this locations exhibits none of the values I learned or I received that allowed me to be proud of my serving and interpersonal skills and where I got them.  Every time I come to this location I am completely ashamed of the level of lack of care complacency and ignorance we encounter. Our servers don't know what is on burgers (say they sneak out of burger tests easily), always forget the modifications we ask for (and we have to wait while their food runners fix it while our food gets cold), don't clear piled up items of tables (say their manager is really mellow and doesn't really care if they are on top of things), never bring fry refills (always too busy with their four table section to remember) and take eons to get a drink order in or a bill (they aren't up on service times as it's pretty mellow there we are told). It's a perfect example of doing the bare and frustrating minium and offering zero apologies when it affects the guests time, food, experience and comfort.I could go on but I think you get th gist.  This is a perfect location and know it's the only reason people come back...as it cannot be the servers. The RR execs should do theirselves a favor and get some proper management and training to this location because without it we will never come back and we will tell everyone we know to avoid it and head elsewhere instead. PLEASE FIX THIS LOCATION ONCE AND FOR ALL RED ROBIN!

Rob robin has always been a pick for me but recently has not been. Ive been about three times to give them chances before reviewing, but I just don't like how slow their service is.  Take FOREVER to get your food, every time. If its not your food, its waiting for your server to come back to check up on you for refills.  But I, by all means, will come when I'm not watching my timing.
Weird.....but I really like Red Robin. Clucks and Fries.....bottomless fries. Possibly one of my guiltiest pleasure spots.

I've been coming to this red robin for a really long time. I've gotten to know the staff, so each time I come in I feel welcomed and like I'm hanging out with friends. Alex is thee best bartender ever!!! He's quick, efficient and super sweet. He always remembers what I get and knows how I like it. It's the little things like remembering a face or an order that keep a person like me coming back over and over again. Thank you Alex, see ya soon friend.
One star, just cause they don't allow kids in the booths in the bar area. TGIF does. So we went there.
This place has horrible veggie patties they have no flavor and the texture was awful. With so many other great vegan options around this is not a place I would go.

One of the best severs EVER. Her name is Alex she has short blonde hair and cute as a button. I have had other servers there and they were fine but Alex so far is the best. Anything we asked for she did it and the place was so busy. Very nice personality and always asking us if we need anything else. Thank You Alex, I will tell my friends to ask for you anytime they come to Red Robin...:)

The reason I'm writing this review is the hostess Claire. She always takes care of my to go orders quickly and with a smile. She knows how to take care of her customers and makes sure you have everything you need before you go. I really appreciate her hard work and I hope her managers do too. Thanks Claire!

HAPPY HOUR ONLY:  I didn't really want to write a full review, this is more just a public announcement: THEY NO LONGER DO LATE NIGHT HAPPY HOUR. They used to do 3-6PM is happy hour, and 8PM to closing, but now it's only the 3-6PM!!!  We got there Wednesday night a little after 8PM, and the waitress sat us down. When she took our order, we asked if there was a happy hour, and she said yes that should be starting. So it was $1 off adult beverages and 1/2 off a couple of appetizers like wings and nachos which are normally $9. We each got a drink and wings to share. The drinks are good (honestly they are pretty cheap. $5.50 for a house margarita?!) and the food is fine. No complaints about that.  Then when the bill came out, we noticed that the happy hour was not included. So we asked the waitress, and she said she would go fix that for us. Then the manager came back and actually said they no longer do the happy hour, but for us, he ended up comp'ing the nachos we got, so we still got a similar discount than if we got it from the happy hour. The waitress came and apologized to us too, saying she didn't know they don't do late night happy hour anymore. She said it was her first day back from a break, and didn't know until now either.  Good thing the manager was nice about the situation and still gave us a discount, but a little sad they cancelled it! I'm always down for happy hour, especially with good drinks and a good vibe!

Our server is amazing! Definitely great service and we've always loved red robin so this is the cherry on top. My girlfriend and me were seated in fast time and our server provided us with with quick service and its only the beginning. We're eating now and I couldn't even wait to get home to write this review I'm so happy with the service. Jordan you are the best!! Thank you for the great service

Hadn't been to Red Robin in a long time, so thought we would give it a try when in the area for a movie. I was really disappointed.  The wait staff seemed to be in conflict, running around and many didn't seem to be sure of which tables they were serving.  We were seated in a booth, the table was sticky and our waiter disappeared for a bit.  Finally back with menus, they were also sticky, yuck!! I found the food to be a bit boring, and it was just an uncomfortable experience.  When it came time to pay the bill, he had the wrong charges, finally fixed it and then handed us the tablet type machine to pay with, wait, wait, come back, we are paying cash.  We finally had to snag another wait staff person to get our waiter so we could give him the cash and he seemed annoyed. There are so many great restaurants and burger joints around, I won't bother with Red Robin again.

Good food. Friendly fast service. Plenty of menu items and plenty of park. A lot of families come here especially on the weekend so it can get loud. Television screens show football games but no sound.
Sitting in the bar at Red Robin in Costa Mesa and Alex is killing it! Best service here ever!!! Fast friendly and let us relax before ordering. Doesn't get better than that.

This place is absolutely magical. As soon as I walk in the door, the smell fresh French fries is wafting in my nostrils. I am always greeted by the brightest of smiles and the friendliest hellos. The staff at Red Robin is incredible and provides the most excellent customer service, comparable to that of a gourmet restaurant. The cuisine at Red Robin is unmatched by any restaurant.
